190464.name: Survival Index
190464.description:
User summary:

Characters in Survival Index have five Attributes that correspond to a body "part" (in actuality, to a body ability). These parts are Head, Arms, Core, Legs, and Spirit. Each part has five levels of damage; when a part sustains the fifth damage level it becomes inoperable (with consequences depending upon the part). The game uses a simple dice mechanic to determine outcomes in critical situations.

The game is distributed as a three-page PDF file; the third page contains several character record sheets. The game layout allows each page to be cut into six index cards for distribution (a play on the "index" of Survival Index).

190466.name: ¡Viva San Judas!
190466.description:
User summary:

Characters in the formulaic game are randomly assigned to players from a pre-built list. Characters also have two Attributes: Publicity and Aggrandizement. Once the characters are created and assembled into a "Cabinet", a crisis randomly is determined and play begins, with each character attempting to gain the ascendancy to the highest political office. Whatever it takes.

190467.name: Bot (2014)
190467.description:
User summary:

In Bot players run characters that are robots, or bots. Players select a bot Type for their character, which provides a "Factory Default" of dice allocation among four Attributes: Brawn, Brain, Security, and Repair. Characters have two addition dice to distribute by player fiat. The dice pool for each Attribute then varies from 0 to 4.

Bots perform whatever tasks they are assigned by the BOSS (game master), gaining an energy cube for each day's performance.

190468.name: Kung Fu Panda: Showdown of Legendary Legends
190468.description:
Kung Fu Panda: Showdown of Legendary Legends is a video game based on the Kung Fu Panda franchise. It was released on a number of platforms including Nintendo 3DS, Wii U, Xbox 360, Xbox One, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, and Microsoft Windows in Europe on November 27, 2015, and in North America on December 1, 2015. The Wii U version was released on December 15, 2015.

The game is a 2.5D brawler game like PlayStation All-Stars Battle Royale, Super Smash Bros., Mortal Kombat and other fighting games. The game will have "Tournament of Legends" mode, Practice Mode (similar to other fighting games), VS Mode, Team Play, and Tag Mode. Multiplayer will have the option for offline and online play.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kung Fu Panda: Showdown of Legendary Legends", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190469.name: Ajagara
190469.description:
User summary:

Characters in Ajagara have six Attributes: Control, Determination, Harmony, Honor, Mindfulness, and Purity. These Attributes align with the six major virtues in Ajagaran society. Resolution within the game involves a simple D6 roll compared to a target difficulty; in very difficult situations 2D6 are rolled and if either fails then the action fails. The game is surprisingly subtle and complex for such a short product.

190470.name: Blood in Your Mouth
190470.description:
User summary:

Characters in Blood in Your Mouth are former humans now consumed with the predator within--as the game states "pus and viscera within a skin of decency". Character creation is entirely freeform. Action resolution heavily favors narrative process, but sometimes dice are used. Characters roll several types of dice representing several character aspects. Depending on which rolls are "successful", the action proceeds along one path... or another.

rpgitemversion: dual language Italian/English edition, PDF Version
190471.name: West!: Tokens, Ruler, and Haven
190471.description:
Publisher blurb:

(Italian)
Insieme di mappe e miniature/tokens per le avventure di West!
include mappe di:

Saloon
Ufficio dello sceriffo con prigioni
Miniera (componibile)
23 Tokens

(English)
Set of maps and tokens for "West!". It includes maps of:

Saloon
Sheriff's Office with prisons
Mine ( Modular )
23 Tokens

190472.name: Star Wars: Galaxy of Heroes
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
190472.description:
Star Wars: Galaxy of Heroes is a mobile game developed by Capital Games and published by Electronic Arts. The game received a soft launch in Australia during October 2015, and was formally released on November 24, 2015. Galaxy of Heroes was announced at the 2015 E3 Expo, where it was announced as a collectible card game RPG.

Gameplay for Galaxy of Heroes allows players to collect characters from the Star Wars universe, create teams with them, and use them to fight battles. There are multiple ways to collect characters: some are given to players immediately, whereas others are gained via game play or as in-game rewards.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Wars: Galaxy of Heroes", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190473.name: Whip it Out
190473.description:
User summary:

Characters have four "Stats" (Attributes... sort of): Fight, Banter, Drink, and Swagger. If needed, a random "situation" can be generated. The purpose of the game appears to be to determine which character can be the biggest jerk, which is resolved by a game of Rock-Paper-Scissors. Should this result in a tie (?) then a die roll is used. Advanced rules provide for a sort of semi-LARP play style.

190474.name: Highscum
190474.description:
User summary:

Character creation is free-form and involves selecting four Traits, or narrative descriptions. These Traits will provide bonuses at appropriate times. Tests involve utilize a dice pool of D6.

The game is distributed as a three-page PDF; the third page is a character record sheet.

190475.name: Heartfire
190475.description:
User summary:

Heartfire is a complex game that uses cards to drive the action. Characters in the game have several atypical aspects and traits. The game is presented as a two-page PDF, but it presents a layout that is best utilized by printing and placing the pages side-by-side for use.

190476.name: Memories (2014)
190476.description:
User summary:

Memories is subtitled "a collaborative storytelling game for 4-6 players". The game is a diceless, narrative process that utilizes a series of index cards and a play structure to generate an individual story for each player's character. It is intended that all of these individual stories share intersections with the other stories.

190477.name: We Is Goblins!
190477.description:
User summary:

In We Is Goblins!, players have characters that are goblins. Character life expectancy is not great. Characters are created by distributing ten points into nine available Skills (called "Know-Wots"). Skill ranks run from 0 to 10. Action resolution involves a D6 roll; a 5-6 indicates success. Goblins with an applicable Skill may roll additional dice. The game attempts a comedic style of play.

190478.name: The Secret Society of Singular Specialists
rpg: The Secret Society of Singular Specialists
190478.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are mundane humans with a singular ability--in essence, some type of super power or truly exceptional ability. The resolution system involves rolling a dice pool of D6 and then discarding high-and-low dice according to a formula, until a single die remains. If that die indicates a success, then the action is successful.

190479.name: Alea Iacta Est!
190479.description:
User summary:

Alea Iacta Est! character creation is free-form and involves each player establishing a few narrative traits for the character that describe what the character is good at. Broad categories provide a small bonus across numerous actions; specialized categories provide a large bonus for a single type of action. The game uses a single mechanic to resolve everything--2D6, possibly modified, compared to an action table.

The game is distributed as a three-page PDF; the third page is a character record sheet.

190480.name: Existential Crisis and Dungeons
190480.description:
User summary:

Existential Crisis and Dungeons presents an unusual role-playing experience. Characters select an Aspect, which is essentially a stereotype, that provides motivations and shortcomings. Characters start the game with three "Fate Chips", which may be spent to achieve a few options. Characters may work together or (more likely) at cross purposes.

190481.name: Out of the Depths (2014)
190481.description:
User summary:

Out of the Depths presents a fantasy adventuring party with an escape-or-die scenario. Characters have five Attributes (Sword, Rations, Armor, Treasure, and Torch). Attributes have an associated dice assigned from a standard array of D4, D6, D6, D6, and D8; in effect, characters are "good at" one task and "not so good at" one task. Each Attribute allows for an in-game action attempt; success depends on a roll result that varies by ability.

190482.name: The Tower
190482.description:
Each player grabs eight cubes with variously colored faces and sets them on the table before them, ”silly-face” sides facing up.

One player grabs the tower, flips it upside down, gives it a shake, and then places it back on the table. Eight colored balls immediately fall down into the tube in a random order. As soon as the eighth ball lands on the top, the game begins and the race is on. Players start flipping and stacking their cubes to perfectly match the order of colors in the tower.

Players must be careful, however, as each cube holds a different combination of colors. The color needed once a player gets to the top might be lost in the cubes down below—the player will then have to take it all down, rearrange their cubes, and stack it all over again.

The first player to stack his or her cubes and perfectly match the tower wins the round. The first player to win three rounds wins the game.

190483.name: Down to New England Town
190483.description:
From the introduction:

The investigators will be driving through a small New England town on their way to some other place when they will encounter a police road block. There will be two police cars and four officers. They are armed with 9mm pistols. They are stopping every car and are searching it carefully. When the Investigators reach their turn, one of them will recognize Officer Jennifer Hansen (she went to high school with the investigator and they were friends for a while).

190484.name: Dominate: The Sliding Puzzle Game
190484.description:
One player rolls both dice. The numbered die indicates the start point for this round, and the die with symbols indicates the finish point or 'goal'. As soon as the dice are rolled, play begins. At once, players race to connect their start point to the goal by sliding their path tiles to form a continuous path. Path tiles may not be picked up, they may only be slid.

Once a player finishes the path, he or she grabs the goal tile from the center of the board and keeps it until the end of the game. Then it's time for the next round. Players do not move or re-shuffle their tiles in-between rounds. Take turns rolling the dice to begin each round. If you roll a goal that has already been taken, re-roll the symbol die until it shows a goal that's still on the board.

The first player to get 4 goal tiles wins the game. If there is a tie of 3 each, an extra round is played. The goal tiles are reset and the dice are rolled. The winner of this 7th round wins the game.

190485.name: Bug Wars
190485.description: Bug Wars is a crazy battle where you blast your opponent's bugs. Strategically set up your five bugs on your Battlefield. Load your pump gun with soft darts and knock the heads off of your opponent's bugs as fast as you can.

190489.name: Diamond in the Rough: The Battle for Fort Driant, October 1944
190489.description:
The Battle for Fort Driant marked the end of Patton’s campaign in the Lorraine. Following the breakout of the US Third Army from Normandy and its drive across France, Patton’s forces had fought hard and victoriously. However, by the end of September shortages of fuel and ammunition forced General Dwight D. Eisenhower to order a halt. Those supplies that did get through were diverted to British General Bernard Montgomery’s forces to the north for the upcoming Market-Garden offensive. Frustrated, Patton ordered a “reconnaissance in force” to take Fort Driant, the last German-held position barring Third Army’s way to Metz.

Believing the fortress to be held only by rear echelon personnel and demoralized remnants of units that had retreated into its works, Patton felt the position could be easily taken by a reinforced battalion of the 11th Regiment of the 5th US Infantry Division (nicknamed the “Red Diamonds”), the only unit he could provide sufficient fuel and ammo to continue offensive operations. However, the German garrison was well prepared to resist, with elements of the 17th SS (Kiss My Ass) division nearby for support.

In actuality the US forces attacking Fort Driant would be outnumbered and outgunned. The ten day battle that raged at Fort Driant was marked by bloody and fierce fighting that at times was waged hand-to-hand and both sides calling in “final protective fire” upon their own positions. In the end the 5th Infantry’s “blood and guts” would not be enough, and Patton would order his only retreat of the war from Fort Driant. Can you do better?

190490.name: December 2015 Free Monster of the Month: Snow Angel
190490.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the pages of Holiday Heroes & Horrors 2: Holiday Horrorers, comes the snow angel.

Snow angels are creatures made of pure light from the Superplane of Light. Snow angels appear as ghostly sheets of waving light with a roughly humanoid form. Despite their awe-inspiring appearance, snow angels are as deadly as they are beautiful.

190491.name: Gunpowder
190491.description:
When the dastardly Boss Grimshaw swindles the innocent townspeople of their gold to fund his railroad, a lone hero emerges: Incendio. Inspired by the tale of Robin Hood, Incendio sets out to make Grimshaw pay through the nose. Armed with their wits and a keg of gunpowder, players must help Incendio liberate the town's stolen gold by blasting Grimshaw's safes and piggy banks sky high through a series of carefully choreographed chained explosions.

Gunpowder is a one of a kind physics-based puzzle game featuring colorful artwork, a charming backstory and clever game design that is sure to appeal to gamers of all ages. With a simple swipe of the finger, Gunpowder is easy to pick up but offers ever-increasing challenges through thought-provoking brainteasers, immersive physics-based gameplay elements and the use of numerous environmental objects - flaming wagons, Gatling guns, chandeliers, cannons, mine carts and more!

With 125 unique levels, timed trials, numerous Easter eggs, unlockable achievements and the ability to compete against friends, Gunpowder can be played many times over, as players seek to find the fastest and best way to solve each puzzle.

Source: The Game Website.

190492.name: Krai Mira
190492.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




A Post-Apocalyptic RPG inspired by Fallout

Scorched by the sun and hopelessly irradiated, the Earth is soaked in toxic waste and blood of its former masters. Those who remain are fighting to survive the endless and senseless struggle with the environment, and, inevitably, with themselves.

Source: The Game Website.

190493.name: Sword Art Online: Hollow Realization
videogamehonor: 2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PlayStation Exclusive Game of the Year Nominee
190493.description:
User Summary

Sword Art Online: Hollow Realization is set in the world of Origins.

190494.name: Alter World
190494.description:
The Game is inspired by Stephen King’s book – “The Dark Tower”. The game is a 2D platformer with an interesting gameplay mechanics. Player can travel to an alternative universe anytime and use an alternative universe reality to move to another level. Levels are unique, with puzzles, and player will have to react quickly and assess when to move between the Worlds. The game has unique art style, like a painting.

Source: The Game Website.

190495.name: Tribal Trouble
videogamehonor: 2006 IGF Awards Technical Excellence Nominee
190495.description:
The game pits natives of tropical islands against invading Vikings.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tribal Trouble", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190496.description: The Flip Hop Bonus Card is shuffled into the first 10 cards of the mission cards. When the Bonus Card appears the only difference is that only the visible snails has to be on the right place. The Flip Hop symbols can be represented by any other snail.
190496.name: Flip Hop: Bonus 1

190497.name: House on an Island
190497.description:
From the introduction:

In this adventure, one of the investigators runs into a bit of luck: one of his distant relatives passed away some time ago, leaving him partial ownership of a house on an island off the coast of Maine. On the minus side, the investigator must share the house with another distant relative and his family. On the darker side, the house and island have a terrible secret history, a history that will plunge the investigator into the depth of horror.

190498.name: Lord Karma has Gone Insane
190498.description:
From the introduction:

The court of Lord Karma is surprised to find that he is suddenly babbling unintelligibly and unable to comprehend the most simple thing. There's nothing for it but to embark on a mission to find the only thing that can possibly save him! A Call of Cthulhu Dreamlands adventure for five players.

User summary:

Originally run at Vaticon 2000. Includes pre-generated characters and is presented as a "one-shot" adventure for a single session.

190499.name: Niteside Dreams
190499.description:
From the introduction:

A Film Noir Setting For Call Of Cthulhu.

User summary:

This setting is targeted at the 1920s era campaign and includes nine major sections serving as resources for establishing tone and setting. Includes a guide to slang and an extensive bibliography of various forms of media.

190500.name: Retry
190500.description:
In Retry, the goal is to send an airplane from one hangar to another hangar in different places. There are many obstacles between the two points, including air and moving landscapes. In order to move the plane, the players must simply tap the screen. The plane will then move forwards and upwards. Releasing the finger from the screen makes the plane move down. (Wikipedia)

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Retry

190001.name: Kobold Story
190001.description:
From the introduction:

A Kobold's life is short and violent. Each player (except the Game Master) must make a new Kobold at the start of the game and every time their previous Kobold dies. Each time this happens, subtract 1 from the tribe. At 0, the tribe faces extinction, as the players are the last Kobolds left.

User summary:

The resolution mechanic uses opposed die rolls where a Kobold rolls D6 compared to the game masters roll (of 1D6, 2D6, or 3D6, depending on difficulty). High roll wins. Each kobold has one advantage and one disadvantage, determined by the player at creation.

The game received "Honorable Mention" in the Two-Page Tabletop Competition.

190002.name: Star Nomad 2
190002.description:
User Summary

A space trader & combat sim meets squad-RPG, large scale conquest.

190003.name: Dragonpath
190003.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Carve a bloody path through a broken underground realm inhabited by vicious monsters and few struggling remnants of civilization.

190004.name: Police Cops
190004.description:
User summary:

In Police Cops every character is an "awesome, cliché cop" with three Attributes (Strong, Fast, and Smart). Attributes have a dice pool associated with them. Opposed actions are made with the dice pool against a target difficulty number running from 1 to 10; rolls of 5 or 6 count as one success. All failures are considered "humiliating failures".

This game received "Honorable Mention" in the Two-Page Tabletop Competition.

190005.name: Abandoned Train Cars
190005.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 282nd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features apparently abandoned train cars in the desert.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

190006.name: All Things Truly Wicked
190006.description:
From the introduction:

All Things Truly Wicked (ATTW) is a horror game, where the players take on the roles of young children and teenagers, in order to investigate and explore the strange evil that afflicting their small, suburban neighbourhood. Only the children can see these horrors, and only they have the power to stop them.

User summary:

This game was a co-winner of the Two-Page Tabletop Competition. The third page of the document is a character sheet.

190007.name: Union of Magical Child Care Professionals
rpg: Union of Magical Child Care Professionals
190007.description:
From the introduction:

As you are well aware, our organization exists solely to help our wards grow into mature young ladies and gentlemen. At the beginning of your career you will likely be entrusted with a single ward of no exceptional talent. During the course of an adventure it is inevitable your ward will face adversity, in which success is not guaranteed. This is their chance to take action!

User summary:

The game was the co-winner of the Two-Page Tabletop Competition. The third page of the document is a character sheet.

190008.name: Elzaya
190008.description:
From publisher blurb:

Elzaya, Queen-Empress of the Infraverse

Elzaya is the leader of the Seventeen Worlds, a portion of the Infraverse. She and her forces have come to Earth-Prime to get revenge for war crimes against her people from the unlikeliest of sources. Can your players figure out what’s really going on while facing off against a full-scale invasion?

190009.name: Russia & Central Asia
190009.description:
From publisher blurb:

The former Soviet Union once dominated Eastern Europe and central Asia. Elements of its influence are still felt there on Earth-Prime, from ancient figures out of myth like the witch-hag Baba Yaga to the effects of Chernobyl and the shadowy UnterKremlim. Heroes can work with Bogatyr, the greatest hero of Russia, or battle against foes like the Four Horsemen, deadly leftovers from secret Soviet super-soldier programs, while wondering who the mysterious hacker known as Delphi works for, and what her agenda might be.

190010.name: East Asia
190010.description:
From publisher blurb:

The star of China rises on the world socioeconomic stage, but what is the strange secret of China’s apparently burgeoning superhuman population and why are so many of these nascent superhumans seen only once to twice, and then never again? Learn about the Sprinter, latest of Japan’s fad of “fan vigilantes” and of the dangers of nearby Kaiju Island. Who are the mysterious costumed Koreans Ying and Yang and which Korea do they call home? Heroes can deal with Southeast Asian pirates, vengeful ghosts, and the arcane powers of the mysterious Ophidian Magus of Angkor Wat.

190011.name: The Krinch That Stole Father Winter's Day
190011.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Holiday Adventure for a Level 3-4 Adventuring Party
Designed for use with the world’s most popular role-playing game

Nerdarchy would like to dedicate this adventure to Gary Gygax & Dave Arneson who’s creation has led so many on innumerable adventures, Dr. Seuss who gave us the gift of The Grinch & all of the who’s down in Whoville, & our Loyal Nerdarchists.
As always- Stay Nerdy!

190012.name: Moat Houses & Pillboxes
190012.description:
From publisher blurb:

Manor houses not defensive enough for your needs? Upgrade to the next level in defensive measures to ensure your safety.

Revised and expanded, Castle Builder Reforged, Chapter 3 takes you through the ins and outs of the myriad ways you can use manor houses to provide flavor to any adventure or campaign.

A partial list of what you’ll find inside:

Sample maps

turning the manor house into a more formidable stronghold
understanding when and why that might be a good or bad option and the consequences

190013.name: Hatred's Snare / A Distant Dream
190013.description:
From publisher blurb:


Hatred’s Snare

Gorge Wolves have the town of Yulotov, in Steppengrad, under siege. What has brough Baba Yaga's banes to the city? Can the Accursed defeat them, or can they find the root of the curse and elminate that instead?

A Distant Dream

A caravan leader's nightly visions of the Djinn have drawn the attention of Memnon. Are the dreams real? If so, should the Witchmarked help the dreamer to uncover the origins of these dreams or slay him, so that they cannot be fulfilled?

Hatred's Snare and A Distant Dream are a pair of 1-Sheet style scenarios that focus on the adventures of a band of Witchmarked heroes in the Accursed game setting. The adventure may be played as a standalone, or it may be used with the Plot Point Campaign included in Accursed. The adventure features brief scene descriptionss, with necessary game mechanics and opportunity for tasks that can be resolved in a variety of ways.

190014.name: London Bridge Has Fallen Down
190014.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mylarkt—Mars’ oldest city, home to a proud and fading race. But that pride masks a rot festering in the cracks of the city’s decay, an underworld teeming with smuggled goods and ancient artifacts sold at the behest of local crime lords to be shipped out along the ancient canals of which the city’s founders were pioneers—or so the inhabitants claim.

No sane Earthman would enter this pit of iniquity willingly—but who can refuse the request of a grieving noblewoman? Lady Edith Tillington is mourning her husband, a scientist in her Majesty’s service, who crashed in the desert onboard an ether flyer called London Bridge. She is now in need of bold, Mars-proven adventurers willing to help her recover the remains of her late husband. The characters arrive at the ancient Martian city only to find themselves at the very heart of the city’s quarrels, with the colonial powers, local smugglers, assassins, and the ruling elite of Mylarkt all playing out their own selfish schemes. In a wild chase, they will find themselves forced to make their way deep into the Isidis Desert, where they will be confronted with the best kept secret of the Empire!

This adventure includes a detailed description of the city of Mylarkt, including a city map, with additional locations, factions, and thrilling plot hooks providing inspiration for further adventures in and around Mylarkt, a city with a long history and powerful interests at play.

190015.description:
Cthulhu Tales is a storytelling card game for people who enjoy the weird tales of the Cthulhu Mythos, love games and have a sense of humour with a touch of darkness to it...

Incarcerated in a sanatorium, you must convince the staff that you are sane by telling the story of the terrifying events that led you there. The other players try to disrupt your tale to make themselves look more sane in comparison, and the success of your tale determines which misguided therapies and medication are administered by the terrifying medical staff. These treatments are the way the game is scored, the player ending with the least amount of treatment is the winner, and is free to go.

Each player is trying to persuade the sanatorium staff that they are sane and can be released. As well as giving a convincing account of their own story, players can improve their chances of being freed by casting doubt on the other players’ tales – making themselves seem sane by comparison.
190015.name: Cthulhu Tales

190016.description:
Faerie Castles is a Rummy based card game. Players compete to build castles in the lands of the fair-folk whilst trying to defend them against the various inhabitants roaming the faerie realm.

Players collect cards that form the structure of their castles, which they may play down in front of themselves. However when drawing new cards they may encounter the various creatures and peoples of the faerie realm who will try to attack and destroy the castles built there. If defeated these attackers are imprisoned in the dungeons of the castles and add to a players final score. Should they be victorious the castle is destroyed and the players work begins again.

Artwork is presented in a black and white style to allow children to colour the cards themselves, individualizing their own copy

Faerie Castles is an entry in the 2015 Children's Game Print and Play Contest.
190016.name: Faerie Castles
boardgamefamily: Children's Game Print and Play Contest

190017.description:
100 Swords: The Blue Mammoth's Dungeon is a sword based dungeon crawling micro deck builder! Load up with as much as you can carry and run head first into the dungeon, exploring rooms and revealing monsters, all while keeping track of hidden treasures and swords!

During play, you must efficiently play the 5 cards in your hand for any combination of movement, strength, or energy. Movement advances you deeper into the dungeon allowing you to peek at or reveal the cards along the way. Monsters you find can only be defeated with strength. New items (and swords!) are acquired by spending cards in your hand for energy. Many items have effects that will further expand your tactical options as your deck grows.

As you defeat monsters and pick up loot, do your best to remember where everything is hidden. Treasures and slain monsters are worth gold, so get collecting! Once the dungeon has been thoroughly ransacked, or the boss is defeated, whoever has the most gold wins!

This deck is a standalone dungeon complete with items, monsters, and a Boss, the dreaded Blue Mammoth. This dungeon has hard hitting monsters and harder hitting swords.
190017.name: 100 Swords: The Blue Mammoth's Dungeon

190018.name: Quickdraw
190018.description:
User summary:

Quickdraw presents a rules-light fusion of American Western and typical Fantasy tropes. The game utilizes stripped decks of playing cards for action resolution. Opposed actions are resolved with a (possibly modified) card draw compared to a target difficulty. Characters have four attributes (Brawn, Agility, Smarts, and Toughness) that may provide bonuses to associated actions.

190019.name: Warhammer 40,000: Conquest – Legions of Death
190019.description:
From the publisher:

“The soulless ones shall be the harbingers of dark fate. Then shall come the living dead, the progeny, then the thirsting ones, the forever damned, and the galaxy shall run red as the blood of Eldanesh.”
–Translation of an Eldar artifact, Codex Necrons

From the ancient depths of time before the galaxy was consumed by war, a new threat now emerges from its aeon-long slumber: the Necrons have begun to awaken once more. No loyal servant of the Imperium could fathom how many Tomb Worlds still lie dormant, only awaiting some mysterious signal to rise and spread doom across the civilised worlds. Now, as the Necrons ascend and swell their armies with slaves, all the Traxis sector will learn to fear these mechanical terrors.

Legions of Death introduces the Necrons as a new playable faction for Warhammer 40,000: Conquest. Two new warlords lead the Necron forces in the Traxis sector, and new mechanics evoke the theme of a Necron invasion whenever you lead them into battle. As the Necrons, you can enslave the peoples of the galaxy, filling your deck with units from other factions that are forced to fight alongside you. Although the Necrons hold the spotlight in this deluxe expansion, you’ll also find a new unit for each of the other eight factions alongside new neutral cards that promise to impact the game in entirely new ways!

190020.description:
100 Swords is a sword based dungeon crawling micro deck builder! Load up with as much as you can carry and run head first into the dungeon, exploring rooms and revealing monsters, all while keeping track of hidden treasures and swords!

During play, you must efficiently play the 5 cards in your hand for any combination of movement, strength, or energy. Movement advances you deeper into the dungeon allowing you to peek at or reveal the cards along the way. Monsters you find can only be defeated with strength. New items (and swords!) are acquired by spending cards in your hand for energy. Many items have effects that will further expand your tactical options as your deck grows.

As you defeat monsters and pick up loot, do your best to remember where everything is hidden. Treasures and slain monsters are worth gold, so get collecting! Once the dungeon has been thoroughly ransacked, or the boss is defeated, whoever has the most gold wins!

You can use Dungeon Builder Sets to spice up your dungeon. Each set contains 15 cards (including a new Boss) that can be slapped onto a standalone dungeon to lengthen your game and add new challenges and puzzles to solve! The Glowing Plasmapede Dungeon Builder Set is a good all-around set of cards. It has an interesting variety of monsters and items with dungeon visibility and card manipulation effects.
190020.name: 100 Swords: The Glowing Plasmapede's Dungeon Builder Set

190021.description:
From the publisher:

"Clean yourself up, and play the game. Play the part like you always have, and maybe you’ll survive. Frag this up, and you’ll wish you’d never been born."
–Ibrahim Salem

Election Day is here in Fear the Masses, the sixth and final Data Pack in the Mumbad Cycle for Android: Netrunner! After the Indian Union's election cycle has hinged upon heated debates over clone rights, the election's final events will carry forward for many generations…

Featuring some of the most potent and deck-defining cards from the whole Mumbad Cycle, Fear the Masses carries the cycle to its climactic conclusion, but leaves it to you to deal with the fall-out. Sixty new cards (including a complete playset of nineteen different cards), feature plenty to excite fans of both NBN and those Runners who identify themselves as Anarchs. NBN gains a new identity, a new region upgrade, and two potentially game-changing assets. Meanwhile, as they march against Corp HQs, the Anarchs rally the masses toward dissent and high-pressure discard strategies.

Of course, there's plenty for every faction, and Fear the Masses offers neutral cards for the Runner that give you good odds of bypassing Corp ice for free, as well as a neutral agenda for the Corp that's worth two agenda points, but only requires three advancement to score.
190021.name: Android: Netrunner – Fear the Masses

190023.description:
This is a Kickstarter exclusive mat that can be played with units from any of our 3 games. It fits nicely into the extra mat slots we provide with Hoplomachus:The Lost Cities and Hoplomachus:Rise of Rome.

This Kickstarter add-on adds a different arena to the game and features two massive white pillars in the centre. These are impassable hexes – you cannot move a unit on or through these hexes. Likewise, the pillar spaces cannot be included when counting hexes in Attack, Move or Tactical range (this includes all basic and alt attacks, tactics, abilities and innates). They still do not block line of sight however.

There is also available online an extra ruleset featuring a 'capture the flag' style challenge particular to this arena and a video overview for the ruleset and arena mat.

190025.description:

Ever since Wil Wheaton wrote about his experience Ending Santa Claus — which he wrote about in the foreword for the Mythender Roleplaying Game — people have asked for details about that game. 190027.name: New Gods of Mankind Basic Rules: Gods, Armies, and Tribes
190027.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the N.G.o.M. (New Gods of Mankind) basic rule system for Gods, Armies, and Tribes. This system allows for gods and armies to be added seamlessly to your gameplay, expanding your story, and giving a tribe for your heroes to belong to.

In New Gods of Mankind, you will create a character—a deity—and play out the god’s actions and responses to a setting and plot described by Fate. There is no clear-cut winner or loser; you are successful if your god grows in strength and power, and unsuccessful if your god is forgotten or your followers are extinguished. It is your goal to become the biggest and most powerful god you can. The other players are trying to do the same, however, and you will also have other, far more experienced deities and spirits trying to kill off or convert your followers so you do not succeed.
More importantly, you “win” if you and your friends have fun, even if your god is crushed and forgotten.

It is my desire to give you a condensed version of the New Gods of Mankind ruleset I created with several others back in 2006.

These rules will be readily adaptable to any game system. My goal is to see you use part or all of these rules for your next game. I want people to create their own worlds and have fun writing stories with their friends.

190028.name: Pörssipeli
190028.description:
This game takes you to the exciting opportunities of the stock exchange, where, with right investments and some luck, you can make a lot of money, but also lose it all.

In the game there are 12 different stocks (in 4 different color, 6 of each individual stock), wich players buy from and sell to bank. At the start of the turn one player rolls four different colored D6 four times, to determine the value of the stocks. Then every player buys and sells his stocks starting from the player who throw the dices. The current price of the stocks is marked on the board.

Basic idea is to make more money then the others. The game ending is decided by the players before the game begins. It can be a money or a time target.

190029.name: Downside
190029.description:
User summary:

Characters in Downside have four Attributes (Tough, Cyber, Rogue, Psy) with one or more dice assigned to them at creation time, from a pool of eight dice. Characters also have Quirks (traits) that may impact game play. Conflict resolution is handled by rolling a dice pool (determined by the relevant Attribute) against a target number which may be the opponent's relevant ability roll.

190030.name: Two 17 Year Old Boys as High and Gentle as Clouds
rpg: Two 17 Year Old Boys as High and Gentle as Clouds
190030.description:
Author's summary
They're close friends exploring the night under the influence of something that makes everything feel beautiful, two boys tightrope-walking the line that spills over into adulthood.

You're a living room full of people lounging comfortably as some music murmurs in the background, and together the lot of you are going to have an introspective conversation from the viewpoints of these nighttime wanderers, these Two 17-Year-Old Boys as High and Gentle as Clouds.

Two 17 is released as part of the author's Patreon.

190031.name: Coding Gear
190031.description:
In Coding Gear, players compete to infiltrate the opponent's install gate or remove the opponent from the board.

Each player has a set of nine tokens: two each that show movement to the four cardinal directions (north, south, east, west) and one that shows your install gate. At the start of play, each player secretly chooses one of their tokens and places it on their install gate, with these gates being located at opposite corners of a 3x3 grid. Then they each program three moves on their side of the board.

The first player reveals their first token and carries out the move, then second player carries out their first token, etc. If you choose the install gate, you must choose one of your tokens and place it face down on your install gate; if you choose movement, you must move one of your tokens one space in that direction.

If you move or install on an opponent's token, you capture that token; on future turns, you can use that token to program moves, but you can't place it on the board. If you move or install on your own token, you stack them; on future turns, if you move a stack of at least two tokens, you can jump an empty space with some of the tokens, leaving at least one token behind.

If you remove all of the opponent's tokens from the board, you win. Alternatively, if you simultaneously occupy both install gates, you win. If you can't move or move your only token off the board, then you lose.

190033.name: Turnee
190033.description:
This game is similliar to Kimble/Turnee

The game is abstract, each player has set of pawns of his color. Each turn player rolls a die and selects one of his pawns to move. Pawns can enter the track from Home base only on a roll of five or six. Each pawn needs to travel around the board and finish on the Finish lane. If pawn of another player is stops in to a same game square , the bumped pawn is returned to home. The goal is to be the first one to get all the pawns to the Finish lane.

The trick is that the game board is a squere with circles in the corners. The home bases are in these circles. There are also X shaped gates at corners wich turn everytime a pawn goes through it. This way every other pawn would go to the square route and every other to the circle route.

videogamehonor: 2014 AzPlay Awards Best Game Design Nominee
190034.description:
User Summary

A Kickstarted episodic point and click adventure game that is set in a post apocalyptic future.

190035.name: Commit the Garde!
190035.description:
Commit the Garde! is intended to simulate battles of the Napoleonic wars on the grandest of scales. Entire epic battles are represented; no longer must the players extrapolate the results of the entire battle of Waterloo based upon their game's recreation of the fight for the garden gate at Hougoumont. Players represent the highest level leaders in any given battle, and as such make the decisions that will shape the entire battle. Gone are the minutiae which their historical counterparts left to their subordinates, your focus is on your army's brigades, not on the battalions and squadrons.

Decisions made by lower level officers are abstracted into the mechanics of the game, players should understand that there is someone at the lower level who should be taking care of those details (spacing of battalions and squadrons, deployment of skirmishers, sighting of artillery sections, availability of spare ammunition, etc). Like it or not the real commanders had to trust subordinates to do their duty well. Often these abstract subordinates will make mistakes (represented by bad dice rolls), whether or not your subordinate's failure is catastrophic to your plan will depend on the allowances you have made for that possibility. This of course is a good reason to have plenty of reserves available.

And speaking of reserves, the most unique aspect of Commit the Garde! is the use of off-table reserves. No longer can your opponent see the deployment of your entire army. The location of your reserves is not determined until you commit them to the battle, at which time you place them where you want them (with limitations based upon distance from your Army HQ and proximity of enemy forces). The skill of your army commander and staff determine how effectively you can commit your reserves.

The game is played on a hex-grid map; the reason for this is to remove the ambiguities of "free movement" common to most miniature rules. With hexes there is no doubt about a unit's location, it's facing, and what the range is to any other unit on the battlefield. The intent with this approach is to make this a game/simulation of decisions, not of inches.

190036.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 16.

This special noble Patron can be used in any game of Splendor.
190036.name: Splendor: Special Noble Patron

190037.name: Clown Helsing
190037.description:
User summary:

In the game, the game master is known as the RingMaster and is in charge of the Vampire, the Scenery, and Bystanders. Players run characters that are always Vampire-Slaying Clowns. The game utilizes specialized dice based on D6 with various faces and colors. Characters have Traits, which are narrative descriptors. One of the Traits should be a Flaw. Traits will modify appropriate die rolls.

190038.name: Duels of Cartisora
190038.description:
User summary:

Duels of Cartisora is a gladiatorial combat simulator. Characters select a Class (Gladiator, Knight, Monk, Swashbuckler, or Rogue) which has influence on the randomization process, but otherwise the game is a "shotgun card game" intended for quick games with little continuity. Characters flip cards each round of combat and consult an action table to determine the outcomes. Dice are used in certain results.

190039.name: Bloodlines
190039.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have four Attributes (Brawn, Finesse, Heart, and Mind) which have values distributed from a point pool. Action resolution uses a dice pool based on the relevant Attribute, with each "1" counting as a success. A table determines the type of dice to be rolled (D4, D6, D8, etc.) based on the attempted action's difficulty.

Characters must select a Lineage (Angel, Changeling, Demon, etc.) which will yield a single special trait and general characterization. A (concise) bestiary also is provided. The third page of the document presents a character sheet.

190040.name: Superfight: PAX Prime 2015 Promo Pack
190040.description: This is a set of nine cards for Superfight that was released at PAX Prime 2015. Each swag bag contained 1 random card.

190041.name: Monopoly: Florida Edition
190041.description: A variation on the classic monopoly board. The pieces are all the same as classic Monopoly, however the names of the properties are places and businesses around the Sunshine State - Florida.

190042.name: And Then...!
190042.description:
User summary:

And Then...! is designed to be a super light-weight game system that new players can utilize to be up and running within just a few minutes. The rules are developed into three layers, each building on the last: Little Rules, Medium Rules, Most Rules. New players could start with the Little Rules option and then, after some play, move on to the Medium Rules option.

Characters have four Attributes (Muscles!, Brains!, Speed!, and Help!) which are rated from 0 to 10, with points distributed from a pool (Help! always starts at 1). Task resolution uses a D6 (or variable dice type for increased difficulty) with a 1 being a failure and a 6 being the best possible outcome. The rules contain several random tables and a character sheet.

190043.name: Spartan
190043.description:
From the introduction:

A player character (PC) in Spartan is built out of three elements: skills, aspects, and fate boxes. Skills give each PC quantitative strengths and weaknesses. Aspects tell the character's story. Fate boxes illustrate physical and mental condition, and also serve as a resource of narrative control.

The three elements are closely connected. Skills are used to create and destroy aspects not only about the PCs, but about the entire in-game world – to write an aspect is to create the effect it describes. In turn, aspects can be invoked to skew the odds on a skill roll by drawing attention to a relevant story detail. Fate boxes are the fuel that powers this back-and-forth... and for mortals, that fuel is very much exhaustible.

User summary:

The third page of the document presents a character record sheet.

190045.description:
Drink! is an easy icebreaker for your house parties. It gets people laughing and chatting. The game keeps your brain moving and your eyes peeled as you joke around with friends and goad them into downing more and more of their beverages. Drink! brings all the fun of a game without slowing down the party.

The rules of Drink! are simple. Every player draws a card from the game box. On that card is an action or phrase they should watch for. Whenever someone does what the card says, the card holder commands that person to “drink” (take a sip of their beverage). They can wait a few seconds or trick people into performing their action, if they want to be cunning. If anyone can guess what the card says, they keep that card for the rest of the night and can still call out that rule. If they guess wrong, they must drink. If you lose a card, you get a new one. The winner is whoever has the most cards at the end of the party.
190045.name: Drink!

190046.name: Dagome Iudex
190046.description:
Dagome Iudex is a game that implements early Polish history into the card play.
It's based on traditional card game Rummy with few minor changes and different scoring.
It features historical places like Biskupin or Giecz and historical figures i.e. Mieszko I or Otto III.

190047.description:
In Into the Black you are a members of a space pirate crew boarding a federal star ship with the primary goal of taking over the bridge!

Each player controls a number of Space Pirate Characters to perform actions (move, attack, retreat, search, equip/trade items). As you search through the star ship looking for the bridge you reveal the layout of the Star Ship, one tile at a time. Be careful upon entering an unknown room; you never know what might be laying in wait for you!

Events such as Enemy Defenders to fend off, a dangerous Plasma Leak or hazardous Artifical Gravity Failure add potential peril behind every door. Also behind those doors can be found some fantastic booty! Loot includes helpful items, such as stim packs to heal you or another character, weapons to help fight defenders, armor to help protect against defenders and more.

Each Pirate member of the crew has his or her own Personal Goals as well (as any good pirate will) .. but beware; one of those crew members just may be a traitor working for the Federal Authorities or his own personal gain!

Reach the Bridge and defeat the Federal Star Ships Bridge crew before meeting any number of failure conditions to win the game – together!
190047.name: Into the Black: Boarding Party (A Game of Space Piracy)

190048.name: NIP'AJIN Alone at Home
190048.description:
Publisher tagline
Burglars want to get in. Kids want to keep them out. Who will win?

Introductory text from the item

It is December 22th. You are 9 to 12 year old kids of two related families, traveling to a rich aunt’s house in a New York suburb. There you are supposed to spend the days before Christmas, so your stressed out parents can prepare everything for the holidays.
It is snowing heavily when the cab drops you off at the driveway at noon. The pre-payed driver mumbles something about this being his last trip for today – the streets will be closed, a small blizzard is coming in the afternoon.
At the front door then the big surprise: Nobody is home! Thanks to a hidden key in the yard you can at least enter the house and call your parents. Well, there was a misunderstanding with your aunt. There is Pizza in the freezer. Wait until tomorrow morning and please, please don’t do anything stupid.
Alone at your aunt’s mansion the fun stops during a snowball fight as you eavesdrop on a conversation of what seems to be a corrupt cop. He talks to a friend on the police radio: It’s like a ghost town here – nobody is around, the ideal time and place for burglary. He agrees with the other person to meet
here at dawn – right before your aunt’s house – to rob the neighborhood.
You call your parents again, but they don’t seem to believe your childish stories. Instead they order you to not go to the police as it might look bad: Why are there kids in a house without supervision? So it’s obvious what you have to do: defend the house and make sure the burglars don’t steal your aunt’s pricey possessions!

User summary
This is a short scenario playing with the core idea from the 1990 movie Home Alone by John Hughes/ Chris Columbus. The scenario was first published in German in the anthology NIP'AJIN Shots.

190058.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1549; Stage One: Ryan Rhodes; Stage Two: Russell Borogrove; Stage Three: Joshua Fox




From the rules text:
It’s been ten million years since the humans left this Earth. They left it polluted, exhausted,
spent. Irradiated ruins, acidic oceans, scarred earth and mountains of waste.
While the humans floated through the ether, held in stasis in their hermetic capsules, the Earth
has endured. She has lived on, transformed, evolved. Those same malignant forces the
humans unleashed have shaped the Earth’s development. And in ten million years we have
evolved – the Sapients, the new masters of this old planet.
We are as diverse as we are intelligent. We are resourceful and adaptive. This Earth is not one
the humans would recognize, but it is our home. And now, we must defend it.
After ten million years, the humans have returned. They have come to make a new home on a
new Earth, to settle and expand and consume and conquer. Can the ragtag,
disunited Sapient
coalition save the earth from humanity?

Der zweite Teil der Solo-Abenteuer-Reihe „Der Dunkle Fürst“ führt nach Felsbrunn, einer kleinen Stadt nahe des Großen Waldes. Überall singt die Vorfreude durch die Gassen, denn am Abend soll Juvios Fest gefeiert werden. Doch Sie sind nicht nur auf ein paar schöne Moment nach den vergangenen Erlebnissen aus. Etwas Böses rührt sich im Großen Wald…

The second part of the solitary adventures "Der dunkle Fürst" brings the player to Felsbrunn, a small town next to the big forest. Everyone is looking forward to the big Juvios celebration in the evening. But you are not only looking for some pleasures after the last adventure. Someting evil is rising in the forest.

190061.name: In der Falle
190061.description:
Im dritten Teil der Solo-Abenteuer-Reihe „Der Dunkle Fürst“ kehrt man zurück zum Großen Wald, um dem Treiben des Kultes ein Ende zu bereiten. Doch bereits zu Anfang ahnt man, dass diese Herausforderung am Ende auch mit dem Leben bezahlt werden könnte…

In part three of the solitary adventures "Der dunkle Fürst" you return to the bid forest to set an end to the dark cult. But already in the begining you start to realize that this task may cost your life.

190062.name: Titanomachy
190062.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. From the rules text:
Sing, O muse, of the gods themselves. Bold Zeus and silent Hades; kind Demeter and stern Hera. Lords of earth, sea, sky, and underworld. Sing of their feuds and their liaisons! Their loves and lusts and hates. The great beasts they have slain, the arrogant mortals they have humbled, the lovers they seduced, the oracles to which they told their secrets! Sing to us of their bodies, sculpted in marble, ideals we strive to approach, but always fall short.

No. Sing to me of the gods as they really are.

In myth, the gods are just like us, men and women, drawn at a grand scale and given overwhelming powers. That is how we choose to remember them. This is not a game about those memories. This is a game about what really happened.

The gods were born as specks of dust.

190063.name: American Heroes
190063.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1553; Stage One: Jonathan Hansen; Stage Two: Eva Schiffer and Alan De Smet; Stage Three: Josh Crowe
Stage One and Two Title: Saturday Morning Heroes




In 2014 nature scientists genetically modified papayas to resist a strain of papaya blight and save the papaya industry. No one could have imagined the hideous side effects. The first effect was that many of the papayas grew to enormous size and absorbed tons of atmospheric CO2. This CO2 reservoir ended global warming trends, if they ever existed in the first place. The second, and even more shocking, effect was that people born to consumers of the papayas often developed superpowers. I mean these things are complicated and the earth did pass through the tail of a radioactive comet that night when all cactuses became sentient. But most people are pretty sure it’s the papayas. When will people learn?
While most of those developing super powers led the lives of normal, law abiding citizens 0.1% turned towards lives of crime (as high as 0.3% in some groups of minorities). Thus the US department of homeland security was forced to put together teams of super powered people to deal with these threats. Threats not just to safety and property, but threats to the American way of life itself.
You are heroes because you are on this team. And you fight people who are villains because they dare oppose America and the American way of life.

190064.name: Explorers of the Lost Valley
190064.description:
The life of an English gentleman can be quite boring sometimes, with all that privilege and comfort. That's why a group of old friends have decided to leave their mansions and enter into the dark depths of an unexplored region of África. There, they will find living, breathing dinosaurs!

The adventurers put together a little competition: Using their wits and modern weapons, they will try to catch alive as many animals as possible for the London zoo. The loser will have to shave off his moustache. Some emotion, at last!

Explorers of the Lost Valley is a card game for 2-4 players with a playing time of 20 minute per game. Two cards are drawn from the deck, showing a wide variety of scientifically inaccurate dinosaurs. The players can decide which one to fight, or discard one of them. If you decide to fight, roll the dice; if the result is equal or higher to the difficulty of the dinosaur, you can take it as a prize. The easier-to-catch dinosaurs give fewer points than the more difficult ones. If you fail, you lose some "explorations points". If you lose all your explorations points, you can continue playing (losing all your prizes), or you can stop playing (keeping the dinosaur you caught).

When the last card is drawn, the player with the most points wins!

•••

La vida de un caballero inglés puede ser bastante aburrida a veces, con todos sus privilegios y comodidades. Por eso un grupo de viejos amigos han decidido salir de sus mansiones y viajar a las oscuras profundidades de una inexplorada región de África... ¡¡donde encontrarán dinosaurios vivos y coleando!!

Los aventureros proponen una competición: usando sus habilidades y sus armas modernas, intentarán capturar tantos animales como sea posible para el zoo de Londres. El perdedor tendrá que afeitarse el mostacho. ¡Algo de emoción, por fin!

"Explorers of the Lost Valley" es un juego de cartas para 2-4 jugadores con un tiempo de 20 ninutos por partida.

Se roban dos cartas del mazo, mostrando una gran variedad de dinosaurios científicamente incorrectos. Los jugadores pueden decidir contra qué dinosaurio luchar, o descartar uno de ellos. Si se decide luchar, tira los dados: si el resultado es igual o mayor que la dificultad del dinosaurio, puedes conseguirlo como trofeo. Los dinosaurios más fáciles de capturar dan menos puntos que los más difíciles. Si fallas, perderás "puntos de exploración". Si pierdes todos tus puntos de exploración puedes seguir jugando (perdiendo tus trofeos) o abandonar la aventura (guardando los dinosaurios capturados).

Cuando se roba la última carta, ¡el jugador con más puntos es el ganador!

190065.name: Tramcar
190065.description:
Players act as tram drivers, whose task is to carry passengers skillfully through Olsztyn's tram network. The driver who carries the passengers to designated stops within the shortest time is the winner.
The players have four tickets to realize this. Every single ticket has different set of passengers who must be at this stop on time. Then ticket is complete.

Each players have 5 action moves on his turn. In these five movements they can move trams, place a passenger on a tram or remove a passenger from a tram.

190066.name: The Mask and the Daydream
190066.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1556; Stage One: BP Morton; Stage Two: Kevin McIntyre; Stage Three: Rustin Simons
Stage One and Two Title: Mary Sue: the RPG




User Description: This is a solo RPG with no specific genre or setting that focuses on a kind of guiding visualization process followed by note-taking and some mechanics to work through the visualization.

190067.name: Scavenge: Guide to the Galaxy
190067.description:
The future is an unforgiving place, but you've got a ship, there's plenty of debris to salvage, and that's worth something.

Scavenge is a resource-gathering, space-exploring, alien-fighting, randomly-generated board game. Take on the role of a simple scavenger, scrapping derelict ships and taking any job, just trying to get by in a less than ideal future where humanity has spread throughout the stars.

In Scavenge, players cooperatively explore wrecked ships and abandoned or overrun planet-side facilities. Each character has a specific number of Action Points per turn that all them to Attack, Explore, Scavenge, Trade or Heal.

As a group, the Scavengers visit the 'Job Board' and select a mission type:

Scavenge - search a ship or facility for scrap
Recovery - find a piece of equipment from an abandoned ship or facility
Rescue - locate a captive and safely return them to your ship
Eradicate - clear a ship or facility of all enemies




Each mission type will have a number of varied quests that will have unique mission set-up's as well as mission successes and mission fail's that will impact your Scavenger through the Campaign.

190068.name: The Fellowship of Four
190068.description:
From publisher blurb:

A HeroQuest game book.

From the back of the book:
Centuries ago the evil Kyrax was bound by wizardry under the mountains of the frozen North. Now his acolytes are on the brink of freeing Kyrax, releasing his demonic power into the world again. Four adventurers - the young wizard Fortunato, the elf Eilodonas, the mighty barbarian Asgrim and Anvil the dwarf - are drawn together on a quest to thwart the acolytes' plans, a quest to ensure that the terrible power of Kyrax cannot again sweep the land. But will their skills be equal to those of the fames Heroes of ages past? Anything less and Chaos will prevail...

Don the mantle of one of the four would be Heroes - and prepare yourself for a heroic venture. Can you survive the challenge?

190069.name: Dead World
190069.description:
User summary:

Characters in Dead World have three Attributes: Power, Speed, and Smarts. Attributes start at a base of 10 and the player distributes an additional five points at creation (with a maximum of 2 to any Attribute, resulting in an 11 and two 12s). Characters also start with one weapon and three other items. Any action of consequence is based upon one of the three Attributes. Resolution involves 1D20, possibly modified by the relevant Attribute, compared to a difficulty number established by the game master. When characters gain a level, their hit points increase and they gain additional Attribute points to distribute.

190070.description:
The village of Piquant was a very happy place. They had five bountiful farmlands that each produced a different type of food. All of the people had lots of delicious food to eat. But the evil wizard Captious grew jealous and cursed each of the five farmlands. The food grew to a monstrous size and began to attack the village. The people had only a limited supply of cannonballs to defend themselves against the humongous food! Thankfully a giant from the land of Epicure volunteered to guard the village and eat any food that got too close to the village - even though it was food that giants didn't normally eat. The wizard's magic is limited so your challenge is to defend your village until it runs out.

This is a co-op game designed to be played together by a parent and one child. The game contains a single-sheet board, tokens, and a small deck of cards. Players will also need to provide one 6-sided die and about 10 small candies or snacks that the child likes to eat such as M&Ms, Fruit Snacks, or Fish Crackers. The parent should also choose five foods that they would like the child to try eating. I recommend choosing one food from each of the five food groups but any combination of foods will work.

Each section of the board contains a track leading towards the village and is marked by an icon of one of the five food groups. Before the game, assign one of the five foods to each track (markers are provided to help you remember which food is on which track). Each turn, players will draw a card from the deck that will indicate what tracks are attacking the village that turn. Move that marker one space down the track.

The village can defend itself by rolling a die and trying to get a higher number than the advancing token. At any time, the player may use one of their "cannonballs" (candies) to automatically win a battle. If they use a cannonball it is lost forever (the parent gets to eat it).

The giant marker can move along the red line between the "1" spaces. If a giant and a food monster are ever in the same space, the giant may immediately remove that piece by eating it. The child must taste the associated food for this action. The child can push back the food monsters by tasting the associated food.

If any food monster is ever able to enter the village it squishes all the villagers, the game is lost, and the cannonballs are lost (the parent gets to eat them). If the child is able to defend the village until the draw deck is empty, he or she gets to eat all the remaining candy cannonballs as a reward.

This game is inspired by Israeli Independence by Darin A. Leviloff.

This game won 3rd place for Best Co-operative game in the 2015 Children's Game Print and Play Design Contest.
190070.name: Tasty Battles
boardgamefamily: Children's Game Print and Play Contest

190071.name: CAT Interstellar
190071.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




CAT Interstellar is a story-driven science fiction game about humanity’s attempt to terraform Kepler 452b. Pilot a DOG V4 drone on an alien world and uncover the past of a seemingly barren planet.

Source: The Developer Website.

190073.description:
The Contender is a social card game inspired by the vim and vigor of a real presidential debate.

To win, you must use facts, attacks and distracts to convince the Moderator that you are fit to lead the free world. The deck brings you hundreds of one-liners based on real presidential quotes that you'll combine to beat your opponents in the debate of the century.

Players take turns debating an issue drawn from a deck of Topic cards by combining the phrases on the Argument cards to create the most convincing or entertaining argument.
190073.name: The Contender: The Game of Presidential Debate

190074.description: Cacao: Big Market & Golden Temple, which was contained in day 17 of the Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015, is a set of two jungle tiles that replace two specific tiles in the base game (one 3 value market and one regular 6/3 temple).
190074.name: Cacao: Big Market & Golden Temple

190075.name: Are You the New Sheriff in Town?
190075.description:
publisher blurb

Sheriff is a simple system using the humble d6 (part of lets see what we can do with a d6 range of products) that has you mixing it up with all the mean dudes on the range.

190076.name: Tiny Castles
190076.description:
Tiny Castles is a plateau building game featuring castles, dragons, princesses and knights. Oh, and horses.

It is intended for children the age of four, but I have included lots of rules variants and an expansion to make the game more complex for older children (or even adults?).

The game promotes:
- counting
- visual insight
- logic

This game was originaly entered in the 2015 Children's print and play design contest under the name Castle Builders.

190079.name: Minipantalla Savage Worlds
190079.description:
From publisher blurb:

Minipantalla de tres cuerpos donde encontrarás bien resumidas todas las reglas que necesitas para jugar tus partidas de Savage Worlds.

190081.name: Life is Strange
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Adventure Game of the Year Winner
2015 Global Game Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee

2016 SXSW Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2016 SXSW Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2016 SXSW Best New IP of the Year Nominee
videogamecompilation: Life is Strange: Episode 2 – Out of Time
Life Is Strange: Episode 3 – Chaos Theory
Life Is Strange: Episode 4 – Dark Room
190081.description:
User Summary

Life is Strange follows a young woman with time-bending powers. The ability to rewind time allows events to be undone. Every action you make will have a butterfly effect, an idea that posits that even the smallest of changes can have dramatic and significant effects later on.

The first episode was released on January 30, 2015 and the fifth on October 20, 2015.

190082.description:
October 1888: During the construction of the Metropolitan Police headquarters near Whitehall, which would later be known as Scotland Yard, the remains of a body were found. In September, a severed arm had already been discovered in the muddy shore of the River Thames.

There is another murderer roaming the streets of London in Whitehall, amusing himself by spreading the pieces of a poor woman around Whitehall, like some kind of macabre treasure hunt. The identity of this monster and his unfortunate victim are a mystery, the Whitehall Mystery.
190082.name: Whitehall Mystery

190083.name: Dungeon Heroes Manager
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 028 – 10 Games for Essen
190083.description:
Dungeons are full of treasures, and some people return from them covered in glory, gems, and gold nuggets. More common, however, are the ones who died inside! You are obviously tempted by the chance to enrich yourself, but you don't want to be one of those who won't see the sun again. Luckily there are always many idiots lingering in inns who you can trick by promising glory and money, brave heroes ready to enter the deep caves occupied by terrible monsters and risk not coming back with their arms full of treasure.

In Dungeon Heroes Manager, you are sponsors of the "dungeon cleaning operations" in the kingdom. Thanks to public funds (you obviously don't want to risk your own money), you will hire cannon fodder, er, brave heroes in the local inns, equip and train them, then send them toward castles and caves to loot them and clean up of dangerous monsters — all in order to get richer shamelessly.

But note that Dungeon Heroes Manager is a game in which the richest — and not the bravest — hero will win!

190084.name: Black Sails - The Ghost Ship
190084.description:
Black Sails is a macabre and mysterious point & click adventure game best played with lights turned down and volume up. Emerge into the nightmarish depths of the human soul, blurring the lines between truth and fiction.

Adrift in a raging sea with no hope for rescue, two survivors cling to wreckage, trying to survive a few more minutes. A sinister ship appears from the mists.The survivors call for help, but no one answers. Desperate and near death, they manage to climb aboard … but will the ship be their salvation, or their demise?

Source: The Developer Website.

190085.name: Zombie Office Politics
190085.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Old-school style isometric zombie battling game, set in an office with a comedy theme.

190086.name: Picmi Monsieur Madame
190086.description:
Be the first to catch the good character!
Players look carefully at the card and identify the character Mr. Men or Little Miss that appears most often on it. The first player to catch the miniature corresponding to the character card wins! The winner is the player with the most cards.
The game adapts to the age of the child with its 3 levels of difficulty with varying numbers of characters on the same card.

Sois le premier à attraper le bon personnage !
Les joueurs observent la carte et identifient le personnage Monsieur Madame qui apparaît le plus de fois sur celle-ci. Le premier joueur à attraper la figurine correspondante à ce personnage remporte la carte ! Le gagnant est le joueur qui a le plus de cartes.
Le jeu s'adapte à l'âge de l'enfant grâce à ses 3 niveaux de difficulté avec plus ou moins de personnages sur une même carte.

190087.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Imperial Veterans Expansion Pack
190087.description:
From the publisher:

Maximize the impact of your TIE bombers and TIE defenders with the Imperial Veterans Expansion Pack for X-Wing! Two new TIE miniatures come with alternate paint schemes – one gray TIE bomber with the Gamma Squadron's signature white stripe and one TIE defender with the bold red paint scheme shared by Countess Ryad and the Glaive Squadron. Additionally, eight veteran pilots and thirteen upgrades dramatically expand your ships’ capabilities and versatility while a new mission, Disable the Relays, highlights many of their new tricks and tactics!

190088.name: Mice and Mystics: Lost Chapter – Portents of Importance
190088.description:
“King, you say?” asked Zure, and his ears pricked up. “I must see this King Collin at once.” Mr. Redfern’s whiskers drooped, and he said, “He’s clear over in Oakhaven! Dangerous journey at best.” Zure replied, “Danger draws near, borne aloft by a dark wind.”

Portents of Importance is the third downloadable chapter for Mice and Mystics. This lost chapter requires the Mice and Mystics: Downwood Tales expansion to play. Three Oakguard figures from Tail Feathers are also strongly recommended, but they can be substituted in a pinch.

190089.name: OMNI
190089.description:
A dynamic, all-tactical table top game for both novice and intermediate players.

Designed to have players create their own experience, Omni is a diceless, an easy to learn tactical game which increases in difficulty depending on the players involved.

Played with a unique magnet-based controller, each player plan their actions depending on the variables on the board and play them out simultaneously.

To win in Omni, players can either play in Team vs Team or Free-for-all.

190091.name: Zombie Kill of the Week - Reborn
190091.description:
Zombie Kill of the Week - Reborn is a challenging, fast paced, 2D survival shooter! Featuring a compelling single player survival mode and cooperative multiplayer for up-to four players.

Source: The Developer Website.

190092.description:
A family kitty strategy card game.
Many kitties (called in kichua language "misi") are in the streets and they need a home. Your goal is to gather as many of them as you can, and take them to your house.
You use resources (milk, tuna and stamen) to "adopt" them.
Take a card from the resources deck and manage those resources to adopt the best kitty you need for your strategy. All the kitty cards have effects you can use to gather more resources, to steal cards from the other players or destroy opponent's strategies. And you can combine them for a greater benefit!
190092.name: MISI

190093.name: Apple TV
190093.description:
Apple TV is a digital media player and a microconsole developed and sold by Apple Inc. It is a small network appliance and entertainment device that can receive digital data from a number of sources and stream it to a capable TV for playing on the TV screen.

Source: Wikipedia, "Apple TV", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190094.name: Amazon Fire TV
videogamehwversion: Amazon Fire TV Gaming edition (Controller release)
190094.description:
Amazon Fire TV is a digital media player and microconsole developed by Amazon.com. It is a small network appliance and entertainment device designed to stream digital audio/video content to a high-definition television. The device also allows users to play video games with the included remote, via a mobile app, or with an optional game controller.

Source: Wikipedia, "Amazon Fire TV", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190095.name: Project Pulsation
190095.description:
User Summary

Project Pulsation is a shooter with elements of horror and stealth. The distant space station 'Complex' located nearby Thanatos Asteroid keeps a valuable Artifact.

190096.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 86 - Dec 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Table of Contents / In This Issue
190096.description:
Get Organized!

It's never been easier to spotlight organizations in your GURPS game, thanks to GURPS Boardroom and Curia and GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 17: Guilds. We're amping up our organizational efforts with this month's Pyramid - the PDF magazine for roleplayers - as we look at all things group-related. This issue features:


"What's in a Lair?," a guide to making headquarters for your favorite GURPS organizations. It includes a sample base - the Lofty Heights - suitable for inspiration or moving into!
"Designer's Notes: Boardroom and Curia/Dungeon Fantasy 17: Guilds," a peek behind the curtain at those two supplements by their author, Matt Riggsby. Discover how these releases are similar and different, learn how to map the Assistance Requests of Guilds to Boardroom and Curia organization types, and marvel at a faerie court presented through the lens of both volumes.
"The Most Worshipful Royal Society of Teratologists," this month's Eidetic Memory from GURPS Banestorm: Abydos author David L. Pulver.
