Join this group to gain illumination on all things monster-related (or die trying!), or just seek their assistance as you navigate their bureaucracy and customs. The Society also comes with its stats in the Boardroom and Curia format!
"Designer's Notes: Back to School," a return to the classroom with William H. Stoddard, author of GURPS Social Engineering: Back to School. Go behind the scenes with Back to School and tour four example educational facilities; each includes Boardroom and Curia stats and even details on one larger facility using GURPS City Stats.
"The Knights Templar," a Boardroom and Curia presentation of that famed group in three iterations. Your guide is Graeme Davis, co-author of GURPS Crusades, as he showcases versions of the Knights based on history, fiction, and conspiracy.


This issue also delivers a vignette by Matt Riggsby set in the new Car Wars universe, a Random Thought Table that looks at rules as a way to conjure great ideas, plus an Odds and Ends that lets you be a member of a group without knowing it, and gives more details on the amazing Brandon Moore cover. It's a great time to be a part of something bigger, thanks to GURPS and this month's Pyramid!

- Publisher's description

190097.name: Helios
190097.description:
User summary:

Players run characters who crew a spaceship that is presumed to engage in frequent combat with hostile alien forces. The rules cover the operation of the spaceship in combat which is, presumably, a team pursuit. There are no details for individual actions, however, leaving the game experience somewhat undefined and atypical.

190098.name: Tale or Dare
190098.description:
A Game for Adults

User summary:

The game is a very light-weight shared narrative process where all players develop a shared narrative focusing on a single, shared character. A simple mechanism allows for narrative revision when play changes to the next player. The game uses no randomization and has no game master.

190099.name: Zero-Point Posse
190099.description:
Author's summary:

"Men In Black"(ish) meets the N64 Rareware© era on a Steam platform, simulated in a tabletop game.

User summary:

The player characters constitute the zero-point posse, or the "hapless defenders of fate". Characters pursue renegades through a type of surreal melange of dimensions. Action resolution uses a very simple D6 mechanism, ensuring the focus will remain primarily on narrative action.

190100.description:
Tooting Town is a simple tile laying game for 2 to 4 players. The players are each given 3 buildings to visit. The players then build the town by taking turns to lay tiles, finally selecting where their homes should be. The routes are measured by driving a toy car along them. The winner is the player with the shortest route from their home tile to each of the 3 buildings.

The game contains 17 large format (18cm or about 7.5") square tiles, plus 12 tokens. A download of 9cm tiles is also provided. The game is for 2 to 4 players. Players should provide 1 or more toy cars (not essential). The game plays in about 10 minutes.
190100.name: Tooting Town
boardgamefamily: Children's Game Print and Play Contest

190101.name: Dungeon Rush
190101.description:
User summary:

Dungeon Rush uses pre-generated characters and presupposes there will be either 1 player or 3 players, and a game master. Characters are selected and then may be customized by selecting a special "augmentation" from a list of four options. The game master creates an opponent team by spending points determined by the number of players. The game process is fairly structured and proceeds in rounds.

190102.name: Hell Inc.
190102.description:
User summary:

In Hell Inc. players have characters that are demons. Their primary activity is in tempting humans into mortal sins so their souls can be claimed. Demons have three Attributes (Cruelty, Deviousness, and Dark Majesty) with scores obtained by distributing a point pool. Action resolution is very simple. Most of the game is concerned with the process of getting souls, making pacts, and so forth.

The PDF as distributed has three pages but the third page is blank.

190103.name: Sukoshi
190103.description:
User summary:

Sukoshi is, in most respects, a traditional light-weight implementation of a tabletop roleplaying game. It is atypical inasmuch as the characters all are Sukoshi, tiny humanoid creatures. Characters have four Attributes (Dexterity, Intelligence, Strength, and Vitality), with values determined by D6. Characters then distribute points into fifteen Skills, four of which are combat Skills (combat is resolved by using the relevant combat Skill).

190104.name: Activity Family Classic
190104.description:
Combines "Activity Original" and "Activitiy Junior".

Two or more teams compete each other throu explaining terms via drawing, speak oder pantomime.

190105.name: Colorful Imps!
190105.description:
User summary:

Colorful Imps! is an unique role-playing game where characters are children in a modern urban fantasy setting. Adults are unable to perceive magic, but children can. The game uses a fairly typical approach to Skills and action resolution. It is set apart by the use of drawing--characters have magic crayons which can draw things that can become real. The players must execute the drawings.

190106.name: The Tundra Trudgine
190106.description:
User summary:

The Tundra Trudgine is an atypical game featuring a peculiar blend of hostile environment with overt mission goals (that don't really matter... much) covering ulterior motives in a type of layered conspiracy. Game play is structured and characters are distinct. Time, resources, and effort must be expended to survive in the hostile environment but they do not otherwise lead to successful outcomes.

190107.name: Conspiracy (2014)
190107.description:
User summary:

In Conspiracy the players have characters that are employed by a company called Conspiracy, that is the largest independent investigation agency in a world of artificial intelligence and genetically modified humans. Characters have Abilities (Strength, Endurance, Accuracy, and Skill) as well as a Type (Race) and Skills. Most missions probably involve combat of some sort or another.

190108.name: Penny Dreadfuls
190108.description:
User summary:

In Penny Dreadfuls the game master is referred to as the Author. The Author's role is traditional. Players have characters known as Investigators. The Investigators "investigate" a scenario presented by the Author; the game presupposes the scenario will be primarily a puzzle or mystery that can be solved. Difficult or opposed actions are resolved either through narrative development or, if needed, by coin flip using the rules presented.

190109.name: The Room
190109.description:
User summary:

Characters in The Room do not have any defined statistics or abilities. They are assumed to be able to do whatever a "normal person" can do, as determined by the Room Keeper (game master). At the start of the game, the Room Keeper gives a secret note to each player and they subsequently use a limited number of internet searches to attempt to gain more knowledge about their particular secret. The game entirely is narrative unless two players enter a direct conflict in which case each rolls a die and the highest roll wins.

The "goal" of the players is individual and must be pre-determined by the Room Master. Various clues are placed around the room which otherwise is nondescript.

190110.name: Princess Adventure
190110.description:
Max the Mischievous has cast a spell that imprisoned Clarissa the Dragon in a magic cage high up in Rose Castle. The Princesses Blossom, Willow, Luna and Grace ask Max to let Clarissa go, but Max hid the key to the cage in the top tower of the castle instead. The Princesses race Max to the top of Rose Castle to get the key to set Clarissa free.

The board is a 48 piece floor sized jigsaw puzzle. After assembling the board the 3D castle is placed in the middle. Each player spins the spinner and advances the character the arrow lands on one space. The Princesses may also all move forward a space, or backwards a space. If any Princess gets to the top first, the players win. If Max gets to the top first, he wins.

190111.name: Kingdom Hearts HD II.8 Final Chapter Prologue
videogamehonor: 2016 Gamescom Best Add-on/DLC of the Year Nominee
190111.description:
Kingdom Hearts HD 2.8 Final Chapter Prologue is an HD remastered collection of the Kingdom Hearts series, developed by Square Enix exclusively for the PlayStation 4. A successor to Kingdom Hearts HD 2.5 Remix, it was announced in September 2015 and is scheduled to be released in 2016.

Kingdom Hearts HD 2.8 Final Chapter Prologue includes a high-definition remake of Kingdom Hearts 3D: Dream Drop Distance, as well as two new pieces of content to the Kingdom Hearts series. The first, Kingdom Hearts χ Back Cover, tells a new tale of the Foretellers in HD cinematics, while Kingdom Hearts 0.2 Birth by Sleep–A Fragmentary Passage, is an all new game that takes place after the events of Birth by Sleep from the perspective of Aqua. Back Cover and A Fragmentary Passage will be the ninth and tenth installments in the Kingdom Hearts series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kingdom Hearts HD 2.8 Final Chapter Prologue", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190112.name: Kingdom Hearts Mobile
190112.description:
Unlike Kingdom Hearts coded, Mobile is not part of the main Kingdom Hearts story-line. Kingdom Hearts Mobile is a 2D online world known as the Avatar Kingdom where players can explore and roam around freely as their avatars.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kingdom Hearts Mobile", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190113.name: Arctic Adventurers
190113.description:
Publisher blurb:

Arctic Adventures gathers all the materials from Holiday Heroes & Horrors, Holiday Horrorers, and Elementalry: Snow Elementals into one convenient volume jam packed with arctic adventurers, arcana, and adversaries for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

Inside you will find:


A brief overview of a new arctic region, “White Hell.”
New arctic equipment!
14 new arctic spells!
2 new arctic races: Frost Goblins and Snow-Elves, each with an assortment of racial options.


Plus 12 new arctic monsters, including:


Snow Elementals: Fierce and frosty beings of air and ice.
Ferocious Pine: A very mean tree.
Frost Wolf: Arctic predator turned cold-blooded monstrosity.
3 New Golems: Blubber, gingerbread, and snow.
Weribou: The ferocious were-caribou.
Dire Penguin: “The waddling terror.”
Snow Angel: A superplanar being of pure light.
Snow Lurker: An abominable arctic aberration.
Wooden Soldier: Stalwart soldiers made of wood.
Frost Zombie: Chilling undead minions of the Winter Lich.


All these things await you, in Arctic Adventures!

190115.name: King of New Tokyo
190115.description: This is a version of the popular classic monster brawl game using only the components from a "piecepack". Players will roll the 4 piecepack dice trying to knock each other out, or to simply remain "king of the hill" long enough to score the right combination of coins and tiles to win!

190116.name: Five!
190116.description:
Five! is a game with five set of rules, based on the same set of gaming pieces.
These are:

A simple tile placement game
A simple memory game
A bluffing game
A strategy game
A solo game.




It is mainly targeted at the refugees currently coming to Germany.
A crowdfunding will provide the games to the refugees.

In addition to a German and English rules book there are also Arabic, Farsi, Tigrinya and Urdu rules.

190117.name: Dolgrum's Rest
190117.description:
From publisher blurb:

In life, Dolgrum the Builder was a well respected Dwarf. He worked on many notable projects - the raising of the WInter Hall, the carving of the Cavern of Hilfigr and more. His great ambition was to build a family tomb worthy of his own skill. He began work in his 607th year, and worked and worked. Eventually, he died before the completion of the full tomb, but was finally laid to rest. Other members of his family were alao laid to rest in the mausoleum. However, his Great Great Great Grandson, Thorgrum, decided to expand the tomb a little, and unfortunately he lacked the skill of Dolgrum. One day his excavations uncovered a pool of magma, which flooded into the tomb. Poor Thorgrum was killed immediately, and the river of magma that poured from the chamber flooded through Dolgrum's Rest, carving through the statues and intricately carved stone.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 20 battlemap depiciting a Dwarven tomb hall in a cavern setting, with a river of magma cutting through. Fallen statues, rubble and columns litter the floor, and in some cases bury the tombs. The tomb of the dwarf Dolgrum is still intact, although it is now isolated by rivers of lava cutting through the burial chamber.

190118.name: Walking Towns
190118.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Supplement for The Widening Gyre, A Savage Steampunk Setting.

Welcome to Pietre Verde, a charming Alpine town! But this little town is anything but ordinary. In fact, it is the most marvelous wonder of engineering ever conceived and built! Come explore its streets and squares, meet its charming residents, and wonder at the miracle of its very existence!

Welcome to Schwartzstadt, a picturesque town in the heart of Europe! But despite its rural charms, under its normal-seeming streets and byways lurks a dark, murderous secret. Can you survive the terror that possesses the heart of the Dark Town?

Investigate a pair of unique and legendary steam-powered artifacts and learn their deepest secrets. This PDF contains two new amazing gadgets for a Savage Worlds steampunk game, plus characters and adventure seeds to fuel your imagination! Although written for Savage Worlds and The Widening Gyre, these amazing wonders are easy to port over into any system or setting that you can imagine.

During the Franco-Prussian War of 1862-1870, marauding armies overran many small towns and villages. In order to protect themselves, one town came upon a novel solution. Instead of trying to defend itself (a losing proposition to be certain), it would use the age-old solution: run away from danger. Using the latest technology and supported by several brilliant Savants, they put legs on their town, making it mobile. Soon, other towns followed the first one’s lead and now there are many walking towns.

Walking towns are slow and ponderous and make a tremendous amount of noise, but they are simply amazing to witness. In the years since the wars, many of them have settled down in fertile areas, never to move again unless danger looms. Others have become something like gypsy towns, packing up and moving on every few months. Legend says that there are walking ghost-towns as well; mechanized villages which roam during fog-shrouded nights, or silhouetted by the flickering lighting during terrible thunderstorms. Much like the legendary Flying Dutchman of the high seas, these haunted places are seen as an evil omen, bringing bad luck wherever they are seen.

190119.name: The Partisan Carrier Version
190119.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 48 inch by 30 inch, floor plan of a Fighter, Carrier, Spaceship, with Hex, Square and No overlay.

The Zip File includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“If the Red Drudge pirates have been infiltrated by xenos, The Constabulary needs to know.”—Chief Constable Doreen

The Partisan Carrier Version is a single floor interior map of a spaceship that can split in half to function as two separate vessels. Alternatively, you can use it as a two floor ship with the airlocks used as elevators to get to the second level instead.

The Partisan Carrier Version is intended for use in near or far-future science fiction settings.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Hunting the Red Drudge: The focus of the Red Drudge piracy group has slowly changed from stealing cargo to kidnapping humans. So much so that a rival piracy group called Ratchek’s Raiders have actually been muscling in on their territory and stealing more and more cargo. The Constabulary remains confused that their cargo trap was ignored by The Red Drudge last month and Ratchek’s Raiders taking the bait instead.

The Constabulary has received new information from a witness, a human that escaped the Red Drudge recently. She claims that the once human pirates have been taken over by aliens.

The group is brought in as either Constables or mercenary fighter pilots for a new scheme to catch the Red Drudge pirates. Using The Partisan again, they disguise a military vessel as the passenger version of the ship and tithe to the Red Drudge. If the Red Drudge takes the bait, they find that this version of The Partisan is a light carrier and has teeth on both sides of the ship. Can the group catch the Red Drudge this time?

190120.name: Feats of Enchantment
190120.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a two pages of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Feats of Enchantment includes nine new feats for practitioners of enchantment magic: Compel Thoughts, Emotional Impact, Greater Penetrating Enchantment, Penetrating Enchantment, Rapid Dismissal, Shared Mind, Subtle Enchantments, Warmind, Whelming Dismissal, and Wrest Enchantment.

190121.name: Elves!
190121.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Amazing Races PDFs introduce new archetypes, feats, character traits, racial traits, and archetypes for the core, featured, and uncommon races described in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide. Every PDF contains two full pages of high quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Amazing Races: Elves! includes new racial feats, elven character traits, and alternate racial traits for elves. In addition, this product features a new archetype for elven cavaliers: the Green Marshal!

190122.name: The Sighted Seeker
190122.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sighted Seeker is a 20-level based class created from the psionic prestige class of the same name. It contains aspects of the marksman class, ranger class, and sighted seeker class.

This prestige archetype is a full base attack bonus class that is excellent at finding specific individuals using not only active tracking abilities, but of reading the latent knowledge of nearby creatures to seek out their quarry.

It also contains favored class bonuses for the primary psionic races and the Porphyra psionic races and a sample character Tikki Mancatcher, a blue sighted seeker at levels 1, 5, 10, and 15.

190123.name: Death Traps: Volume 1
190123.description:
From publisher blurb:

What's a base without a good death trap or three? Written by Base Raiders author Ross Payton and Caleb Stokes of Hebanon Games, Death Traps Volume 1 is a collection of five unique death traps is perfect for any Base Raiders game. It can also be used in nearly any Fate powered system. From the high tech threat of sentry turrets and shrink rays to the mystical security of the Vigil, there's something to challenge any group of Base Raiders!

Volume 1 contains game mechanics and background descriptions for:

Sentry Turrets: Miniguns to Plasma cannons!
The Vigil: A community of mystically compelled guardians.
Build-A-Base Bombs: Nanoswarms can build bases AND dissassemble thieves at the same time!
Gritty Gas: Bio-engineered weapon that amplifies physical and emotional trauma.
Shrink Rays: No bonus strength, just an incredible reduction in size. Can it be reversed? Who knows!

190124.name: Rebellion
190124.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Argo Galaxy is growing – not physically but figuratively. After years of study, the House of the Alliance has finally decided to open the Hastilion Expanse for full settlement and corporate utilization. Researchers identified numerous planets and moons as optimal for civilization and corporations from around the known galaxy, including Drake Mining and Manufacturing, are making plans to acquire land.

Since its inception, Drake Mining and Manufacturing has prided itself on mining resources and creating high-quality products from those resources to support the entire galaxy. Moving into the Hastilion Expanse provides them with a wealth of opportunities to expand their operations and grow their business. That is, of course, if their new facilities can survive.

New planets are always fraught with hidden dangers from native flora and fauna, pirates, rival corporations, and rebellious populations. Only the strength of Drake’s mercenary force will help them overcome any roadblocks and become successful. As long as they don’t get killed in the process.

Rebellion presents the Heroic portion of the Hastilion Expanse campaign for Mercenary Breed Savage Worlds or it can be used as a collection of adventures for any sci-fi setting. While parts of it were originally published in Savage Insider Premium and the Hastilion Expanse Compendiums, this new campaign book updates that content to Mercenary Breed 2.0 and expands on it.

Rebellion includes:

Heroic-rank campaign missions (also suitable for Legendary rank).
A collection of additional Heroic-rank adventures based within the Drake Mining and Manufacturing setting.
New Xenopedia entries.

190125.name: Under His Skin (5E)
190125.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition compatible adventure for four to six PCs of levels 1-2

Saben Behi is lauded amongst his peers for his study of the very nature of magic has touched lives across the world. But he remains secluded, and has suddenly fallen silent after suggesting he was studying the art of necromancy to extend one’s life forever.

The PCs arrive at the wizard’s tower to find it in disarray, rapidly dissolving into a rotten mess. What has Saben brought upon himself – or worse, what might he have become?

Also included in “Under His Skin”:

A contested borderlands and wizard academy to expand your campaign setting
Extra-planar intrigue, as the PCs get involved with an overly interested outsider
A new monster, the alchemic ameoba
Maps by three time ENnie Award winning cartographer Todd Gamble

190126.name: Frigid Ice Cave
190126.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all dungeons feature the traditional setup of a monster-filled subterranean network of rooms and passages. Woodland groves, haunted houses, druid groves and more can all serve as an exciting backdrop to the PCs’ adventures. Such locations present their own set of unique design challenges, though, for the time-crunched GM plotting the next adventure.

This instalment of Alternate Dungeons presents loads of great details, hints and tips for a GM designing an adventure set in a frigid ice cave. Designed to save a GM’s time while adding flavoursome details to bring the locale alive in the player’s minds, Alternate Dungeons: Frigid Ice Cave is an essential tool in any GM’s arsenal.

190127.name: Ossoko Draconsha
190127.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep within the swamp lies the lizardfolk village of Ossoko Draconsha, founded to honour the defeat of an ancient black dragon who terrorized the area long ago. Starting out as a neutral ground between warring lizardfolk tribes, the village has prospered in recent generations thanks to rumours of its magical, restorative pool. Merchants now arrive regularly at Ossoko Draconsha to trade for exotic and hard to get animal skins, herbs and plants from the swamp. However, recently the sacred skull which symbolizes the village’s neutrality disappeared and something or someone seems to be interfering with the lizardfolk contacting their guardian spirit. If these issues are not resolved, the village could see itself swallowed up by the denizens of the swamp, or worse, taken over by a greedy merchant consortium.

190128.name: Valley of the Rocks
190128.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hidden in a wild, untamed range of wooded hills lies the legend-mantled, mist-drenched Valley of the Rocks. This deep, cliff-fringed valley has lingered in borderland lore for centuries. Many stories speak of the valley’s otherworldly and elusive denizens, its ancient—and impossibly immense—trees and of the many travellers and explorers who have disappeared therein.

Remnant of an elder, forgotten time the valley is both a dangerous place and a sanctuary. For amid the gloom, stand mysterious, timeworn animal sculptures raised up for some unknowable and unguessable purpose. And among the stones linger the shades of the valley’s last guardians—a cabal of ancient, long-dead elven druids—dedicated to protecting their home from all who would despoil its tranquil, benighted depths.

190129.name: Maida 1806: Stuart vs. Reynier
190129.description:
The game Maida 1806: Stuart vs. Reynier represents a small battle of the Napoleonic Wars. The British army under Sir John Stuart defeated the French troops of Jean Louis Reynier. Outcome of battle was decided by British infantry attack on bayonets, preceded by effective rifle volley. Rules focus on infantry tactics.
One battalion is represented by 4 counters. The player determines which order to use at any given time. Various types of orders are represented by different icons. After the change of formation, the players put on the board counter with the corresponding icon. The exception is the square - here we use the auxiliary marker.
The battalion can be formed into a column to the bayonet charge or the line to effectively use firepower. The line order is represented by a square and rectangular counters, if a unit was large enough.
The player can detach a company of tirailleurs, which is represented by a separate counter.
The battle of Maida is regarded by historians as an example of the superiority of the British two ranks line over the "classic" three ranks line. This difference is also reflected in the game. Firepower is expressed as a percentage, which depends on the size. In the case of the British army is 100% - all soldiers can shoot. In the French is 66% - efficient fire through two of the three ranks. For the infantry in column formation or square it is always a 20%. In the case of tirailleurs and artillery on counters are given immediately the effect of fire - a morale check and modifiers for distance, if any.
In the battle only two units of the French cavalry took part. They exist in a double-row line and because of the tactics used (rapid charge) can not fire.
Due to the historical course of the battle, the aspect of command is very simplified. One player draws one commander from a pool (common to both players). Units within its range can move, and further order of shooting is determined (inactive player fires first). Of course, in certain situations very big significance is who will be able to move their troops. The drawing is intended to represent a situation where one of the leaders taking the initiative, and another in spite of favorable circumstances behave passively. In fact, all commanders were on the same level and you can not distinguish any leader that was better than the others.
During the movement the enemy can react. Units with high morale have better chance that they fire, and maybe even counterattack. However, there is always a risk that our soldiers leave the battlefield in a panic escape. That's what happened to experienced Reynier’s veterans.
During the game, the most common procedure is the fire that causes morale check. Each unit (except for artillery and commanders) has a proper rating on a counter. The test is successful when a modified roll of a 10-sided dice is less than or equal to the rating.
Rule book has 12 pages. Many of the rules describe special situations that can happen during gameplay, for example commander participating in bayonet charge. Basic, most commonly used procedures are very simple. Another advantage is the small amount of counters and a simple overall situation. A challenge for the players is the use of their forces at the right time and in proper order. Experienced players should be enough 3 hours for the entire play.

190130.name: 10 Dragonborn Backgrounds
190130.description:
From publisher blurb:

Backgrounds grant you the ability to customize your character even further by suggesting ideas for your character’s history. Likewise, the DM can use backgrounds to make NPCs more memorable with personality traits & their own odd, little habits.

Although the 10 backgrounds we present here are specially tailored for Dragonborn, backgrounds are virtually rules agnostic. Feel free to use them with any game, any race, any character!

We present 10 new backgrounds tailored for Dragonborn & their kin.

Why do assassins constantly try to steal your mentor's notes?
What quests does your Dragon Lord hold for you?
What atrocity befell you that earned you the worst of punishments: banishment from the clan?

190131.name: 100 Bard Trinkets
190131.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oh, you like that tune? I'm so glad. Here, let me show you what's in this box...

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Bards & their admirers.

What causes your fingers to crackle with lightning when you play your lute?
Does this small, glass vial really contain the heartsblood of the King of Soul?
Who is that mysterious man beneath the horsehead mask?

190132.name: 100 Wizard Trinkets
190132.description:
From publisher blurb:

...& THAT's how you summon a type III demon from the Dread Pit. Did you get all that? No? *sigh* Of course not. I know I expect too much from you laypeople. Here. Study this copy of the Demonomicon & we'll try it all again tomorrow.

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Wizards & their arcane academies, including special items for all eight schools of magic from Abjurers to Transmuters.

Can this tiny cage of force really imprison the world's tiniest villain?
What can the prophecy machine tell you?
Why does this porcelain doll move in the night & why does it appear in your nightmares?

190133.name: 100 Warlock Trinkets
190133.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Hokey religion," huh? That's funny. That's what the last guy said before he died screaming for mercy. Want to see his autograph? Sorry, his handwriting degraded a bit after I zombified him...

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Warlocks, Witches, & Cultists of all sorts.

Is this ouija board really made out of what it looks like?
Are you truly the fairest of them all?
Where did this Ngathf lgn’hagw Heyl’r Eph’rt hfan’wlgm iulgn’hP!!!!!!!

190134.name: 100 Sorcerer Trinkets
190134.description:
From publisher blurb:

A "spellbook"? Sir, I contain within my little finger more power than the whole of the so-called "Tower of Wizardry." Why would I ever be interested in anything as banal as a book?

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Sorcerers & their magical ilk, including special items for Wild Magic, other specialities for Draconic Bloodlines, as well as random magical effects.

What kind of effect did the dimensional conjunction have on you when you were born?
Where did this tiny gold dragon come from & why is it stuck in the shape of a crown?
How long before your new companions discover you are not the humanoid you appear to be?

190135.name: 100 Rogue Trinkets
190135.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ok, is the rube gone? Guys, get over here! Look at what that berk had in his pockets! An authentic, genyuwine lawyer license! You know what this means, donchya?!

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Rogues & their cohorts. Incorporated into the trinket tables, we included prizes you might find pick pocketing as well as intriguing treasures you might steal during a heist.

Where could the map scrawled on the back of this tapestry lead?
Why is this clockwork songbird so much heavier than it looks?
Why did the guild boss entrust you with this case & why aren't you allowed to look inside!?

190136.name: 100 Ranger Trinkets
190136.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Steady... steady... NOW!" Suddenly the forest around the noiseome orc raiding party seemed to come alive as they were peppered with arrows & torn asunder by leaping wolves.

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Rangers & their allies.

Could the legends about the monkey's paw be true?
Is this crystal's "radiation" really all that dangerous? Could there be other side effects?
Will you ever see the albino roses of the Subterrean Gardens again?

190137.name: 100 Paladin Trinkets
190137.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oh Lord, Grant me the Strength to accept those things I cannot change, the courage to change those things I can, & the Wisdom to hide the bodies of those who pissed me off!

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Paladins & their brethren.

Where did this locket come from? Why does its voice sound so devilish & yet so tempting?
How long can you keep the remains of the devil Beliel out of the hands of its former cult?
Even better, what good can you down with such power, demonic though it may be?

190138.name: 100 Monk Trinkets
190138.description:
From publisher blurb:

I see you are upset. Here, let me read to you from the Book of Enlightenment, A wise man once said, 'Foregiveness is divine, but never pay full price for late mutton!'

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Monks & their students.

What could the ki-seal tattooed on your body be imprisoning?
Who is that person in your dreams, & why does he seem so familiar?
What secret can you learn from the Scroll of the Iron Claw Technique?

190139.name: 100 Fighter Trinkets
190139.description:
From publisher blurb:

You see before you the hilt of the legendary sword Excelsior, in ancient times torn asunder & scattered to the ends of the earth. It is my quest to reforge this sword to its former greatness. When I do, I shall grind the world beneath my heel.

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Fighters & their kin.

What does the eye in your armor see & to whom does it report?
Will you ever find the one-armed man who killed your sister?
Why was your family charged with protecting this crown & who keeps trying to steal it?

190140.name: 100 Druid Trinkets
190140.description:
From publisher blurb:

With every step, I feel the heartbeat of the world echoe within my bones. Each breeze, every raindrop, is a blessing from the Great Mother. Know now that you have upset the balance. I am the wrath. I am the vengeance. Run & hide, blasphemer, for the Wild Hunt has begun!

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Druids & Mother Nature.

How did an ivy vine get animated into your catlike pet?
Why would cultists be so obsessed with a simple puzzle box?
What could possibly have happened to this poor rabbit to make it think it's a snake?

190141.name: 100 Cleric Trinkets
190141.description:
From publisher blurb:

Yea, & the lord did smite the unbelievers until their flesh did groan & their bones did powder. Alot like wot I got right here baked into my holy symbol. You want a closer look?!

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Clerics & their congregation.

What will the bones predict today?
Does your lord truly speak through your icon, or is it merely a tricksey devil?
How can you remove the invisible crown of thorns you suffer?

190142.name: Incident at Christmas World
190142.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fantastic new Christmas theme park has been built on the pleasure planet of Vastaag. A group of UIG officials will be taking a pre-opening tour and your Agents have been assigned as their security.

From Lapland to Dickens Town, all manner of wonderful technologies and synthetic characters help to bring this magical wonderland to life...nothing could go wrong, surely...not at Christmas....

190143.name: Winter Special
190143.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or OGL campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material based around the natural wilderness theme.

This special volume is three times the length of a normal Deadly Gardens volume and the material all has a winter theme as well as the natural wilderness theme.

In this volume:

Background on The Realm of Eternal Winter
2 Magic Items from The Realm of Eternal Winter: Cask of Ancient Winters, Winter’s Edge
7 Terrain Types: Glacier, Ice, Smooth Ice, Snow, Deep Snow, Heavy Snow and Snow Drifts
6 Winter Weather Conditions: Fog, Rain, Sleet, Snowfall, Snowstorm, Blizzard
6 New Natural Hazards: Blizzard, Crevasse, Frost Wheat Patch, Polar Nexus, Serac and Thin Ice
Prickly Cone Pine CR 12
Shivervine CR 6
Snow Goon (CR 6) and Snow Titan (CR 12)
6 New Natural Items: Frost Wheat, Living Snowball, Living Snow Boulder, Shivervine Whip, Spiked Pinecone and Yeti Pelt
Rules for using Living Snowballs and Spiked Pinecones as Natural Power Components for spellcasting.

190144.name: Seashell Capital Shipyard
190144.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is a large, vaguely seashell shaped, capital shipyard.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

190145.name: Technomagic: Hybrid Magic Items
190145.description:
From publisher blurb:

ANY SUFFICIENTLY ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY IS BETTER WITH MAGIC!

In conjunction with d20PFSRD and Rogue Genius Games, the Four Horsemen present you with the ultimate guide to mixing magic and technology!

With Technomagic: Hybrid Magic Items you learn all the ways super-science and sorcery can combine! Can a living harness protect you from a chainsaw of carnage? Will a psuedointelligence elad your wasteland-wandering barbarian to an animated spaceship? What wonders can exist when thaumaturgy and technology combine? The answer awaits in the pages of this volume!

190146.name: Paradigm
190146.description:
From publisher blurb:

Intelligence? Artificial. Heroism? Real!

As a synthetic man, made by the villainous Nekrotron, Paradigm's (PL 10) morality is still evolving. Since his acceptance as a Sentinal, he has proven his worth to the team, and to humanity as a whole. However, his strange attration to his teammate, Violet, confuses him. But hey, how awkward could it be?

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

190147.name: The Pristine City (Pathfinder)
190147.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this adventure compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, a perfect, untouched city has been discovered deep underground—a city created to honor a legendary dwarven clan. No one lives there...but as you’ll learn, that doesn’t mean it’s deserted. Can you explore the city on behalf of the dwarves, or will you too become part of its buried history?

190148.name: The Pristine City (13th Age)
190148.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this adventure compatible with the 13th Age Roleplaying Game, a perfect, untouched city has been discovered deep underground—a city created to honor a legendary dwarven clan. No one lives there...but as you’ll learn, that doesn’t mean it’s deserted. Can you explore the city on behalf of the dwarves, or will you too become part of its buried history?

190149.name: Creatures of the Apocalypse Codex
190149.description:
From publisher blurb:

This mutant manual showcases 20 nasty freaks to keep your players on their toes.

Included in this tome are the first 13 deviant adversaries from the free PDF offerings: Sickle Foot, Red Harvester, Spikeback, Junk Mobster, Bog-Billy, Scraplurker, Back Hatcher, Quasi, Spiker, Wailing Jhonny, Tyrannosapien, Chest Head, and Talontessa. Also included is the disturbing Muto-Harpy which was previously only available to Society of Excavator members by way of joining our forums, and six never before seen nasties including the troublesome little Nubinz, the grotesque Walking Mouther, slithering, highly venomous Snaykin, enormous yet varied race of Rubble Trolls, winged terror called the Apocalypse Moth, and most fearsome, intelligent and terrifying of all, the Spider Lord.

All of these creatures come with their own mutation listing, and many, an extensive loot table perfectly suited to the sort of fiend they are, the victims they collect, and dwelling place they inhabit. Also included are encounter tables and the full page, text-free art for each beast to be cut out, photocopied or downloaded from the member’s area of our website. Use these full page images as player handouts to show the gamers at your table what their character see.

190150.name: Miscreants, Malefactors & Megalomaniacs Volume Two (ICONS)
190150.description:
From publisher blurb:

The original Miscreants, Malefactors and Megalomaniacs was a big hit with ICONS fans. So, by popular demand, we present Miscreants, Malefactors and Megalomaniacs Volume 2 .

MM&M Volume 2 contains a bakers dozen of bad guys, thugs, supervillains and misunderstood anti-heroes to add some fun to your next ICONS game.

Characters such as:

Crushclaw - Tragic, crustacean hulk with a forgotten past
Bombard - An iron man gone very wrong
Bada Boom - Super-power ganglord with an explosive temper
Gouger - Blood-thirsty merc who hunts superhumans for pay
The Living Reposity -An intergalactic harbinger of global extinction
Manta Ray - Last son of Atlantis who has sworn revenge against the surface world
And More!

190151.name: Emancipation of Clauslandia
190151.description:
From publisher blurb:

Emancipation of Clauslandia is an adventure that has your young party meet with several northern lords for a few missions. One of these missions is the retrieval of some holly for the druid Thane Xmas. He will send the party to meet with the Elf lord Nicolanclauthus to procure this item. Unfortunately all is not well in Clauslandia where the Elf lord has been captured! Can your party free Nicolanclauthus and gain the holly needed for a good payday?

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a party of low-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign! Don’t forget to follow @FilbarRPG for special announcements and unadvertised sales!

190152.name: Diamond in the Rough
190152.description:
From publisher blurb:

Diamond in the Rough is an adventure that has a group of PCs picking up a job for Dwarves of the Shieldcraft Clans in the West Keldon Mountains. It seems that a group of humanoids has pulled off a daring raid to the formerly secure vault and obtained a rather expensive gem. To recover this item the PCs will first have to reach the Dwarves, cross the valley and search the East Keldon Mountain range for these troublesome thieves. Of course finding the group of problems may prove a bit tougher than expected!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a group of mid-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

190153.name: Monteleone Chariot
190153.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes only a hint of an adventure is given to players and more information is required. In FV12 - Monteleone Chariot this is just such a case. As the party reaches town they begin to hear of a mysterious relic from the past civilization and both information and backers must be investigated. Will your party be able to determine facts from fables? Whose interest will they serve in their investigation or will they just try and locate the item for themselves?

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a party of mid-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

190154.name: Penchant for Adventure - 4
190154.description:
From publisher blurb:

Penchant for Adventure – 4 is the solo adventure for a 4th level character. This scenario can be used for the PC to obtain a ‘special’ item that they want. Originally used for a paladin to get his warhorse, the adventure can be tailored to suit the needs/wants of a specific PC. Like all the Penchant for Adventure settings the adventure takes place around the small community of Penchant. Not all of the businesses are in focus for the adventure although details can be feathered in as you need.

The adventure centers on a mysterious dream that the PC has about getting their special item. As the PC arrives in Penchant they realize they have seen the setting before…in their mysterious dream! Several challenges await at the adventurer attempts to locate their goal. As with all adventures in the Penchant series it can be difficult and not for the faint of heart!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a mid-level solo adventurer and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

190155.name: Spectrum Demo Kit 2: Timeline of the Apes
190155.description:
From publisher blurb:

A group of time-travellers find themselves accidentally stranded in an alternate timeline, where a virus has killed 90% of humans, and the few human survivors are at war with in intelligent apes. Was the virus outbreak caused by accident? A deranged sociopath? Militant animal rights activists? Or another time traveler?

This is an introductory adventure for Spectrum: Time Travel Role Playing.

190156.name: Spectrum Demo Kit 1: The Curse of Devil's Gorge
190156.description:
From publisher blurb:

Devil's Gorge, on the Arizona/Mexico border, has been the site of many mysterious disappearances, apparitions, violent conflicts, and odd occurances. In 1961, Apache chief Cochise is falsely accused of kidnapping, and rides into the haunted gorge on the trail of the real kidnappers, pursued by U.S. soldiers. The resulting shootout triggers the 10-year Apache war.

Five time-travellers arrive at Devil's Gorge in 1961. Can they solve the mystery of the gorge without altering history and creating Paradox?

This is an introductory adventure for Spectrum: Time-Travel Role Playing.

190158.name: The Tenth Doctor Sourcebook
190158.description:
From publisher blurb:

Celebrating the 50th anniversary of Doctor Who, this Sourcebook explores the Tenth Doctor’s adventures on Earth and beyond. With detailed information on all the allies, enemies, aliens and gadgets that he encounters, as well as examining each of his adventures, the book contains a wealth of material for the Doctor Who Roleplaying Game, and is also a fact-packed resource for fans of the show!

After sacrificing himself to save Rose, the Doctor regenerates once more and immediately has to defend the Earth from alien invaders in his dressing gown.

Travel back to Pompeii, forward to the end of the universe and set off on a memorable voyage on the spaceship Titanic. Discover you are not alone, find out who Harold Saxon is and thwart the return of the Time Lords (again).

Allons-y!

190160.name: PlayStation VR
190160.description:
PlayStation VR is an upcoming virtual reality headset produced by Sony Computer Entertainment. It is designed to be fully functional with the PlayStation 4 and PlayStation Vita game systems. It features a FOV of 100°, 6DOF head-tracking, stereoscopic 3D, and unwarped output to a TV, either for others to view what the headset wearer sees, or a separate display to compete against the headset user using a standard PS4 controller.

Source: Wikipedia, "PlayStation VR", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190161.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of Chance cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city:others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Crossing borders require extra attention.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring. Anti-terrorist device cards are needed to travel to Syria and Iraq!

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double or triple points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.


Bu harita resmi olmayan bir fan genişleme yapılmış. Wonder Semboller ve Grafik Copyright © 2004-2015 Gün, Inc. sadece ticari olmayan kullanım için Wonder Günleri izni ile üretilmiştir.

Bu özel kartları ve kuralları ile özel bir gemide oyun Ride temel Bilet ilkelerini izler. Oyunun amacı, çeşitli yolları seyahat ve diğer oyuncular outwitting tarafından en çok puan elde etmektir. Ya ABD ya da Avrupa baz oyunları tren parçaları ve tren kartları ihtiyacınız olacak (veya Wonder dükkandan Günleri onları satın alabilirsiniz. İsterseniz istasyonları kullanabilirsiniz.

Bazı değerine sahip her o kenti ziyaret ederek elde edeceği, şehirler içindir: Başkalarının size bilet tamamlamak için ekstra imkanlar vermek Şans kartları ekstra seti vardır. Bu kartlar dağıtılır / aynı miktarda ve aynı 'tutmak / atma' kuralları ile bilet alongwith toplanır. Geçiş sınırları ekstra attention.There yukarı-sonu oyun puanlama için 9 ikramiye de vardır gerektirir. Anti-terör cihaz kartları Suriye ve Irak'a seyahat için gerekli!

Bu sınırlı seçici seçenekleri olsa pansiyon, herhangi bir gri parça veya paralel parça yoktur.

Kurallara birçok yeni seçenek vardır: başında tüm kartları alışverişinde ama tüm yenilerini tutmak: 5 kartları atmak ve 5 yenilerini almak, sizde olduğu gibi: ikili ya da üçlü puan kazanmak: ve çok daha fazlası. Eğer isterseniz vagon stoku size bilet tamamlayarak diğer oyuncuları durdurma avantajı vererek, 3 ulaştığında da zaman çağırabilirsiniz.
190161.name: Turkey (fan expansion to Ticket to Ride)

190162.name: Putin Strikes: The Coming War for Eastern Europe
190162.description:
This near-future what-if is set at 20 miles per hex, with divisions and brigades as the units of maneuver. It covers the first month of the war that could result if Putin decides to abandon the "opaque war" (a.k.a. "gray war") approach and go for it big time.

The idea being to take advantage of the West's (particularly the "old NATO" countries') distraction with the jihad to try to win back all or some of the "Near Abroad" on Russia's European flank.

Before you ask: the difference between this game and "Putin's War," which will be appearing in an upcoming issue of Modern War, is that PS is a strategic (army-corps at 55 miles per hex) treatment with operational undertones, whereas PW is an operational-level treatment with strategic overtones.

The system will be a further-evolved version of the one I used in NNN2, but better adapted to modern real-world military circumstances. In particular, I'm crafting the combat sub-system to emphasize the growing debate on the appropriateness of the "brigading of everything."

The growing complaints are that brigades, BCTs, etc., are too small and weak to last long in an eyeball-to-eyeball First World conventional war, while also being too big to be nimble enough to properly prosecute an urban counterinsurgency war.

190163.name: 100 Dwarf Trinkets
190163.description:
From publisher blurb:

Those fragments are all that remains of the battle axe my father forged. I'll be damned if I let some snivelling goblin get away with stealing my birthright!

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Dwarves & their kin.

What could have possessed someone to create these demonic insect figurines?
Who is this Elf-lady & why is she posing in a portrait with your Dwarf-father?
How can you open the lock on this tome without damaging the ancient, crumbling paper?

190164.name: 100 Dragonborn Trinkets
190164.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Honor?" Puny ape-thing, what do you know of honor? Witness this sword, my Father's sword. In this blade reflects the honor of my clan. By this weapon, I will teach you what honor truly is!

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Dragonborn & their kin.

Who are the "Dragon Sworn"? And can their scroll lead you to their whereabouts?
Which dragon could have created this grisly trophy encased in never melting ice?
What secret orders are contained in the sealed scroll your clan master gave you before you left on your adventures?

190165.name: 100 Elf Trinkets
190165.description:
From publisher blurb:

I see you fail to understand. This is no mere gem we pursue.
It is a memory stone!
To find the castle's secret door, we must rescue the ruby & recover my lost memories!

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Elves & their kin.

What is this horrible black aura your newly-found spectacles reveals around your friends?
Why has this centuries-old coccoon suddenly started wriggling?
Where could this mysterious teleportation circle diagram lead?

190166.name: 100 Gnome Trinkets
190166.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wow! Did you SEE that?! I had no idea these blueprints were for a whizzbang noisemaker (patent pending)!
What happens when I push this button?

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Gnomes & their kin.

What kind of mischief can you get in to with your trick mini-lightning bold pen zapper?
Can you finally get that steam-powered horseless carriage to work?
How will you cash in the favor the warrior ferret owes you?

190167.name: 100 Half-Elf Trinkets
190167.description:
From publisher blurb:

Did I ever tell you the story of how I found that necklace
hidden in a drawer of the princess' bedside table? No? Well, there I was, right outside the royal bedchamber...

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Half-Elves & their kin.

How will this uncanny silver-&-iron coin "open doors" the way the stranger promised?
Who knew that big, dumb ogre could even write, much less want to send a message to your duke?
What could the stupid brute want, anyway? Dare you break the seal?

190168.name: 100 Half-Orc Trinkets
190168.description:
From publisher blurb:

What!? You expect me to just sit here while that fat noble laughs at us!? D'you see this? This is all that remains of the last "blue blood" that thought I was "funny!"

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Half-Orcs & their kin.

What's the story behind the elaborate Gruumsh tattoo covering your arm?
Can you survive when the orclings come to reclaim the clan's heirloom weapon you plundered?
How did the sorceror control your entire tribe with such a puny ring?

190169.name: 100 Halfling Trinkets
190169.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oh, now this takes me back. I remember when I first found this dragon scale. Y'see, my companions had hired me as a burglar & we had just infiltrated the smokey beast's lair...

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Halflings & their kin.

Remember that time your cast iron skillet stopped an arrow
that would've surely killed you?
Your collapsible 10' pole has always been useful! Where would you be without it, huh?
It's frustrating (yet gratifying) that you haven't managed to shake off your adventure-curious cousin. What if he gets himself killed?

190170.name: 100 Tiefling Trinkets
190170.description:
From publisher blurb:

What are you looking at? It's just a birthmark. Yes, yes. I know it's shaped exactly like Tiamat's unholy symbol. It's just a coincidence. Back off!

We present 100 new trinkets tailored for Tieflings & their kin. Featuring:

Over two dozen variations on the typical Tiefling appearance
Mementos of a childhood spent growing up as demon-spawn
Evidence of the attention the infernal & divine realms focus upon you

190171.name: Oculus Touch
190171.description:
Oculus is also releasing a pair of controllers to be used with the Rift, called Oculus Touch. The controllers are sold as a pair, and are mirrors of each other- one for each hand. They are lightweight, wireless, handheld motion controllers featuring a joystick, buttons, and two triggers- one for grabbing and one for shooting or firing. The controllers are fully tracked in 3D space by the Constellation system, so that the user sees them in virtual reality responding to their real world counterpart, giving the user the sensation of their hands being present in the virtual space.

Source: Wikipedia, "Oculus Rift", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190172.name: Be A Better Weapon Master
190172.description:
From publisher blurb:

A longsword, etched with the genealogical line of a dwarven king. An ivory-handled crossbow, once wielded by the realm’s most infamous thief. A greataxe, inscribed with religious verse, begging forgiveness for the sins committed while using it. Only a master storyteller can turn a boring, static weapon into something flavorful and story-driven – and that’s where you come in.

Your weapons will never be boring again.

Inside Be a Better Weapon Master, you’ll find all the resources you need to add fun, flavorful armaments into your favorite roleplaying game. In true Be a Better Game Master form, you'll have pages of practical advice, tools, tips, and inspirational roll tables at your fingertips.

Unsheath hundreds of options for fun and unique weapons.
Bestow legendary names upon your weapons with robust name generators.
Invigorate your tavern brawls with 40 distinct improvised weapons.
Wade through waves of enemies with exotic weapons from throughout history.
Infuse your weapons with rich history using this bounty of inspiration.
Enjoy 40 pages of inspiring content to create a superb experience at the table.

190173.name: Horror for the Holidays
190173.description:
From publisher blurb:

Happy Holidays!

The Christmas spirit has descended upon Pinebox. It’s a time for celebration, a time for relaxation, and perhaps a time when the forces of darkness would give the world some gosh darned peace and quiet.

Unfortunately, this year the Christmas spirit is an actual spirit—and it doesn’t care if you’ve been naughty or nice. The spirit of the last man to be publicly lynched in Texas has risen, and he’s on the trail of a young Freshman at East Texas University.

Oh. And he looks like Santa Claus.

190174.name: Sanctum Secorum (Issue #06 - Dec 2015)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
190174.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is a great deal of potential material to bring to the table based on this story. Tonight we merely scratched the surface, but manage to bring you quite a bit of goodness for the table. Below is a list, by category and author, of what has been added to the Dark Acquisitions page by the Keepers of Mysteries, based on this show. Further contributions from friends of the library will also be found there as they arrive.

Monsters

"Cat" – Bob Brinkman
Horned Monster – Bob Brinkman
Rock Monster Eagle – Bob Brinkman
Tracking Bear – Bob Brinkman
Traveling Rock – Bob Brinkman

Patrons

"Billy Jack" – David Baity

Spells

Stone Form – David Baity

190175.name: The Eaters of Steel (Supers!)
190175.description:
From publisher blurb:

A disgruntled scientist has forged a symbiotic relationship with cyborg nomads from another dimension! He is unleashing them on a hapless populace to feed his own greed as he feeds their tribe with technology and steel. Will the heroes be able to stop these terrifying biomechanical predators? This adventure was created for heroes

This adventure is for use with SUPERS! RED

190176.name: The Eaters of Steel (Savage Worlds)
190176.description:
From publisher blurb:

A disgruntled scientist has forged a symbiotic relationship with cyborg nomads from another dimension! He is unleashing them on a hapless populace to feed his own greed as he feeds their tribe with technology and steel. Will the heroes be able to stop these terrifying biomechanical predators? This adventure was created for heroes

This adventure is for use with the Savage Worlds Super Powers Companion (2nd Ed)

190177.name: Ysenthorp
190177.description:
From publisher blurb:

The frozen lands north of the Wrackleaf Hills are a harsh place to call home. Snow storms, freezing cold and icy winds produce a difficult environment - but also hardy and resourceful people. Snorri Silverspine, an adventurer keen to retire, happened to make camp in the ruins of an old fort. Making a fire in the lee of a crumbling wall, he wished there was a tavern he could sit and warm up in. And then he decided - he'd come back and build a tavern. A few years later, and travellers in the bleak wilderness were grateful to come across a tavern and a warm welcome, with Snorri at the helm. Time passed, and a few more houses appeared beside the tavern and the road, and visitors started calling the settlement 'Ysenthorp'. As for Snorri, he was happy to call himself a tavernkeep - he'll be happy to call himself 'Mayor of Ysenthorp' soon too..


A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depiciting a small hamlet in a cold and wintery landscape. Evening is falling, and warm yellow light spills from the windows of the tavern and houses into the snowy streets. The hamlet is surrounded by a forest of evergreen trees, and built in the crumbling remnants of an ancient fort.

190178.name: Amazon Fire TV Controller
videogamehwversion: Amazon Fire TV Controller (Fire TV with 4K Ultra HD Compatible Only)
190178.description:
User Summary

A game controller for the Amazon Fire TV.

190179.name: Into the Feyweald (Pathfinder)
190179.description:
From publisher blurb:

Into the Fairy Forest!

Into the Feyweald takes your heroes into a world of adventure in the realms of faerie! Guests at the fairiy queen Pryozha's celebration feast, the festivities are interrupted by the creepy, crawly spider-riders serving the wicked witches of the woods! You must take up the quest to find the hidden grove where Yaldira the witch works her dark magic, turning the forest sickly and rotten, battling her evil minions that menace the creatures of the wood. There, in the dark pits of her lair, you must stop her from awakening her cruel queen from her crystal tomb and save the woodland realm! This 1st-level adventure, suitable for a standard Pathfinder game or one using the boxed set for beginners.

The Legendary Beginnings series from Legendary Games is designed to creating exciting adventures suitable for all ages, but specially designed for those new to roleplaying and those on the younger side. The Legendary Games tradition is to combine rich story and background, innovative layout, beautiful aesthetics, and excellence in design that is second to none, allowing you to enliven and enrich your campaign in amazing and exciting ways. This product is the latest in that tradition, and we hope you enjoy using it as much as we enjoyed making it. Pick up this 36-page adventure today and Make Your Game Legendary!

190180.name: ZhanGuo: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 Expansion
190180.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 18.


3 Task Tiles
1 Wall Tile

boardgameintegration: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Dice Masters: Heroes in a Half Shell
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Dice Masters: Heroes in a Half Shell
190181.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 19.

1 Hawkeye Heldenfall card with German text

Hawkeye and his die originally appeared in Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men, but this version was a participation promo from the Avengers Disassembled Organized Play event. You can find his dice in Avengers vs. X-Men boosters (available at your local retailer). Like all Dice Masters cards and dice, you can combine it with your favourites from other Dice Masters expansions!

The card’s text translated into English:
Once per turn, during your Main Step, you may knock out a Hawkeye die you control. If you do, you may deal damage equal to his attack divided any way you choose to your opponent’s characters.
190181.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men - Hawkeye: Avengers Disassembled

190182.name: Motor City Online
videogamehonor: 2000 Game Critics Best Racing Game of the Year Winner
190182.description:
Originally conceived as part of the Need for Speed series under the title Need for Speed: Motor City, all single player elements that may have been developed for the game were discarded in favor of an online-only model. The game featured some role-playing video game elements, such as leveling up after completing tasks (e.g. winning races), and a functional, supply and demand economy for players to get involved in.

Source: Wikipedia, "Motor City Online", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190183.name: Need for Speed (2015)
videogamehonor: 2015 Game Critics Best Racing Game of the Year Winner
2015 Gamescom Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Global Game Awards Best Racing Game of the Year Winner
2016 D.I.C.E. Racing Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee
190183.description:
It is the twenty-second installment in the long-running Need for Speed series, and was a full reboot of the franchise. It marks the series' second eighth generation installment, and was the first Need for Speed title to only be on eighth generation hardware.

Source: Wikipedia, "Need for Speed (2015 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190184.name: Tom Clancy's EndWar
190184.description:
The Nintendo DS and PlayStation Portable versions feature turn-based tactics instead of the real-time tactics of their console counterparts.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tom Clancy's EndWar", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190185.name: Rangers (2014)
190185.description:
User summary:

In Rangers players run characters that are scavengers in a post-apocalyptic society. They travel to the dangerous, poisonous surface world in search of supplies (primarily food) to take back to their home colony. Characters have Attributes that vary during play (Health, Condition, Stamina) and a few Skills that enable combat. The game provides a random list of hazards that may be encountered during a voyage.

190186.name: Supreme Ruler 1936
190186.description:
Supreme Ruler 1936 is Real Time Geo-Political Strategy Game for PC (and soon Mac). Take control of a nation in the World War II era and guide it through a significant Military Campaign, or attempt one of many Set-Piece Historical Scenarios. Players can also customize their play experience with the Sandbox Mode and play as any Nation with their own preferred Victory Condition.

Source: The Developer Website.

190187.name: Suits
190187.description:
User summary:

Characters have Attributes with a score ranging from 1 to 10, purchased from a pool. The four Attributes include Fitness, Dexterity, Wits, and Charisma. Characters also have Skills selected from a concise list. Action resolution involves a card flip from a standard French deck, possibly modified by an Attribute or Skill. The result is compared against a target difficulty to determine success.

190188.name: Samurai Vampires
190188.description:
User summary:

In Samurai Vampires, players run characters that belong to a specific type of creature (Race) that determines many of their innate abilities and powers. Characters also have Stats (Attributes), including Power, Speed, Mind, Armor, Body, and Spirit. Opposed actions involve comparing die rolls of 2D6. The game presupposes a campaign of territorial conquest.

190189.name: Dino Jungle
190189.description:
User Summary

Explore the Jurassic jungle as a dinosaur! Find water, food and safety.

190190.name: Jungle Dino VR
190190.description:
User Summary

The Dinosaur island has various kinds of Dinosaurs in many areas, In addition, you also interact - fear and joy at events that play out.

190191.name: Euclidean
190191.description:
User Summary

Euclidean; a game of geometric horror; a slow descent into the dark, into madness, futility, and despair, where Things greater than you watch and wait and dream.

190192.name: Black The Fall
videogamehonor: 2016 Gamescom Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
190192.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

An odd and unexpected black and white dream inspired by a childhood passed behind the Iron Curtain.

190193.name: Dinosaurs: A Prehistoric Adventure
190193.description:
User Summary

Play and survive as a dinosaur.

190194.name: Pacific Rim: The Video Game
190194.description:
In single-player mode, the player engages in several one-on-one melee battles to earn achievement points and upgrades for their characters. Jaegers have two health bars (as they require two pilots) while Kaiju have one.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pacific Rim (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190195.name: DinoSystem
190195.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




DinoSystem is a 2D, top-down ecosystem and survival simulation that allows players to either manage the ecology of a randomly generated island (inhabited by dinosaurs), or survive in it as a human, dealing with realistic survival mechanics, and with a deep character progression system that tracks how your character’s body adapts over time.

Source: The Developer Website.

190196.name: The Stomping Land
190196.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

The Stomping Land managed to rise over $100,000 on Kickstarter. After losing contact with developer Alex "Jig" Fundora in late 2014, modeler Vlad Konstantinov halted his work on the game in January, and has now moved on to a different game altogether.

It is assumed that Alex "Jig" Fundora pocketed the money and still owes Vlad Konstantinov payment, who actually had to pay the texture artist out of his own pocket. Most models made for the game have been sold off.

190197.name: DinoStorm
190197.description:
Dino Storm – The first MMO with Cowboys, Dinos and Laser Guns.

Source: The Game Website.

190198.name: Runestar
190198.description:
User summary:

Characters in Runestar have several Aspects, including a race (typically dwarf), background, and class. Although a class is defined, in this game is functions primarily as a "high concept" of the character, not a Class in a more traditional RPG sense. Characters have Skills with a numeric rating from -2 to +8, with 0 being the typical default. Original Skill Ratings are purchased from a point pool. The game uses both D4 and DF (Fudge Dice).

The document is three pages long; the final page is a character record sheet.

190199.name: Bank Job
190199.description:
User summary:

In Bank Job player characters are career criminals that engage in various types of criminal pursuits, primarily robbery and burglary by stealth. The game uses Skills and dice pools for action resolution. The game utilizes a pool of tokens (e.g., poker chips, etc.) that are gained or loss during play. These tokens represent the ill-gotten gains of the characters, though the actual value of each token is unknown to the players until the end of the adventure.

The game document is three pages long, though the third page is a character record sheet.

190200.name: Racing Around the Sun
190200.description:
User summary:

Characters are created in a free-form process, starting with 3-5 Skills defined by a narrative tab. Characters also have two motivations (one personal, one shared by the group) and a flaw. Action resolution is determined by 2D6, modified by +1D6 for every applicable "Asset" (bonus) and/or by -1D6 for every "Complication" (penalty). A result of 5 or less is failure, 6-10 is success with complication, and 11+ is success.

The game is distributed as a four-page PDF; page three is a character record sheet, page four is entirely blank.

190201.name: Kingdom Come (2014)
190201.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game belong to a Role (The Lord, The Lady, The Knight, or The Fool) which determines bonuses to Skills (Knowledge, Diplomacy, Martial, Intrigue, etc.). Each character is assigned a House (Hearts, Clubs, Diamonds, or Spades). The game is played with playing cards which are drawn and held in hands. Aces and Jokers have special actions.

The game is distributed as a four-page document; the third page is a character record sheet and the fourth page is blank.

190202.name: Wizardball
190202.description:
User summary:

In Wizardball all characters are students at a Wizard's School who engage in playing a game called Wizardball. Most of the rules are devoted to playing the game - roleplaying elements are somewhat minor and primarily involve improving from match to match. Action resolution uses a dice pool of D6, with the number of dice in the pool being determined by the appropriate Attribute.

190203.name: Texas Hold Up
190203.description:
User summary:

♠♥ Texas Hold Up ♣♦ is a unique fusion of a card game and a roleplaying game. Play is heavily determined by the card game (which works, more or less, like a round of Texas Hold 'Em), but cards have special meanings detailed on an action table and depending upon when, exactly, they turn up. Characters in the game are superheros with the additional twist that the game is set in the American west during the frontier period--cowboy superheroes.

190204.name: West!
190204.description:
Publisher blurb:

West! is a game in a historic and realistic setting; the society and technology is America's 1800s and, as the train and the telegraph are the latest achievements of technological progress, the peaceful coexistence of different ethnic groups is about to explode like a stick of dynamite with the fuse too short.

In West! players will gather in interpreting "ordinary" people, with no superpower or magical ability to help them, but only their tenacity, their weapons and their luck keep them alive; in each adventure will face inhospitable deserts or icy Canadian forests, bandits quarrelsome or devious and deadly Chinese mafia, Indians and sheriffs, all this and more for the opportunity to bring to pass their own destiny, to add their name in the big legend that is the Wild West!.

An environment that varies from the Mexican border to the Canadian North, the coexistence of different ethnicities, each with its moral codes and 50 years of historical events make the West a living world, constantly developing, stimulating and adaptable to all styles of play; West! is not only bullets , dust and beans!

190205.name: Leaves of Chiaroscuro Quickstart
190205.description:
Text from the publisher

Asiyah, a fantastic alternate earth, has entered the Renaissance Age, the Age of Exploration. Ancient philosophies are rediscovered and from them new ones are born. New lands are explored. With the printing press and other inventions, society will be changed forever.

Yet, demons and other creatures from realities beyond Asiyah stalk the world. The wonders of ancient civilizations sometimes hold long forgotten terrors and dark secrets within their crumbling walls.

Included in this document is:

A preview for the upcoming Renaissance setting for usage with the Fate RPG, with a focus on Italy.
All the rules you need to get started playing in the setting.
5 player species complete with new stunts.
An improvisational magic system.
An introduction to the Renaissance setting of Asiyah.
And more!

Player species include

Humans, the elder race who now dominate the world.
Lacerta, the shapeshifting scions of the dragon gods.
Nephilim, born of forbidden unions between humans and the angelic grigori.
Apeiron, children of the four elements and four humours, born of an alchemical experiment.
Therion, chimerical beings blessed by Echnidna.

190206.name: Wer geht mit mir?
190206.description: Each player has to get 6 playing pieces from the 6 outher spaces straight to the center space whith pictures a die. The number die determines which piece may move 1 space, according to the line it moves in. If the color die shows the players color, the player may move 2 spaces. If it shows the color of another player, the other player may move 1 space too. If the die shows a "?" the player moves his piece and choses anoter player who may move his piece too. On a "+" the player may put his piece to it's center space. The first player to get all 6 pieces to their center spaces wins the game.

190208.name: Exist Archive: The Other Side of the Sky
190208.description:
User Summary

Exist Archive: The Other Side of the Sky is heavily inspired by tri-Ace’s, Valkyrie Profile. A huge cast of characters is made to complement one another in battle.

190209.name: Rigger 5.0
190209.description:
From the back of the book:
PREMIUM RUSH
Spin your wheels over slick sprawl streets while drifting away from hot pursuit. Fly through narrow canyons ahead of missiles twisting their way after you. Shrink down to insect size to get an eye on places outsiders aren’t supposed to see. These are just some of the ways riggers jack up their seemingly unending adrenaline rush, as they show that the hardest shadowrunners to hit are the ones that stay in motion.
Rigger 5.0 is the ultimate hot-rod, jet plane, speedboat, and more companion for Shadowrun. With dozens of new vehicles and drones, more detailed rules for vehicle chase and combat, and customization rules, this is a book that every rigger needs to get ahead of the competition and stay there. Get the feel of laying down hot rubber in the cold shadows of the Sixth World and a taste for speed, danger, and a good, clean getaway.
Rigger 5.0 is for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition.

190210.name: Ten Fifty-Seven
190210.description:
Heart of Darkness
Darkness gathers in certain corners of the Sixth World, where no light can enter. The Containment Zone of Chicago has long been one of these dark spots, but government and corporate forces have combined their heft to bring some light to that benighted area, if only because they believe there is profit to be extracted. They have considerable powers at their disposal—but there is also considerable darkness pooled in the ruined sprawl.
