It will be a battle, and as usual, shadowrunners will be used as the front-line soldiers.

In this Mission, runners will be called to investigate the case of some missing people and stolen augmentations. Answers are not easy to come by in the CZ, but trouble is, and runners will encounter plenty. If they want to dig deep into the heart of what’s happening in the CZ, they better stay on their toes and ready for anything.

Ten Fifty-Seven begins a new series of Shadowrun: Missions that builds on the previous season. The setting and some characters carry over, but this Mission starts runners on the trail of intrigue that will build to a frightening, dangerous climax. Whether runners play through the whole series or play through chapters of the series individually, they’re in for a lot of danger—and plenty of fun.

190211.name: Star Wars 1313
videogamehonor: 2012 Game Critics Best Graphics, Sound or Innovation of the Year Winner (Graphics)
190211.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




The game would take a more mature, gritty direction compared to past Star Wars video games and, like 2002's Star Wars: Bounty Hunter, emphasize fast-paced gadget and weapon-based combat using tools exclusive to bounty hunters rather than Force and lightsaber-based combat.

On April 3, 2013, it was announced that The Walt Disney Company had ceased internal development of all LucasArts projects, including Star Wars 1313. Company representatives have indicated that the game may be revived through a licensing deal with an outside studio, but until then Star Wars 1313 remains on hold.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Wars 1313", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190212.name: Fette Ernte
190212.description:
Fette Ernte is German and means big harvest. It is a simple and fun card game for the whole family. It teaches about vegetables, farming and healthy nutrition in a playful way!

Who will harvest most vegetables?

The goal of the game is it to win most cards. Each vegetable has its own strengths in different categories (eg. period of storage, vitamin c etc.). One player chooses the category for the current round and all player choose one of their five hand cards simultaneously. The player with the best vegetable card in the respective category wins against and collects the inferior vegetable cards.

However, weather, pests and illness cards are executed first and trump specific vegetable cards. For instance leaf blight would win against potatoes. So weather, pests and illnesses might ruin your plans.

190214.name: Coyote Trail (Core rules PDF)
190214.description:
Publisher blurb:

This PDF version of Coyote Trail is ideal for those on a tight budget or who prefer instant access.


Optimized System & File


Coyote Trail includes the revised genreDiversion i rules, which provides flexible and consistent mechanics for horses, wagons, character virtues and corruptions, and more, utilizing 2 six-sided dice. The design of the PDF file has also been optimized, so you can download and print it more quickly than similarly-sized products.


Ready-to-use templates to get into the action quickly


Numerous templates for characters, horses, and wagons.


Two ready-to-play scenarios


Perfect as a diversion from your other games.


Story ideas


Numerous story and subplot ideas to help create your own scenarios.


Compatible


Use with Active Exploits Diceless or Impresa. Update characters from Shady Gulch. Easily adapt weapons from the Knuckleduster Firearms Shop.


8.5x11" blank sheets and Disposable Dice™


Print a single page for easy-to-assemble paper dice when none are available.


Expandable


Supplements are available to expand the game.

190215.name: Sociopolio
190215.description:
A veritable relic from the cold war (1974). Sociopolio is played part like Parcheesi and part as Monopoly, and the setting is an imaginary socialist/communist Puerto Rico. The object of the game is to become the "National Work Hero" by reaching the center point of the board.

The board is color printed and styled as Parcheesi, except for each advancing tile which has text similar to the Monopoly board. The gaming pieces are flat coin-like tokens in transparent acrylic. The currency is black ink over white paper, printed on one side. The currency has pictures of different famous Puertorrican pro-independence figures like Albizu Campos and Lola Rodriguez de Tio and display prominently the phrase "Banco Nacional de Puerto Rico".
The "community chest" (with a red star on the back of the card) and "chance" (with the Puerto Rican flag) cards have such bonuses as "Merit; you have fulfilled the work assigned to you by the Revolutionary Committee" or "Voluntary Work at the Hostos School". If you are lucky you may even get a "Double ration of fish, pay two pesos", or a "New pair of shoes". Instead of advancing to the next railway, you advance to the next "red star" or "flag".
Along the way, in each space on the board may have hazards, such as "You didn't perform the work assigned, pay a 10 pesos fee" and rewards such as "You helped fixed the neighbors house, earn ten pesos".

Owning this game back in the day would have certainly landed your name in a government black list.

190216.name: ShipLord
190216.description:
ShipLord is a survival game based on an asteroid dodging mechanics and energy collection, combined with interactive boss fights. The main goal of the game is to survive specific a period of time, collect as much energy as possible so you can progress further into the vast and fully unique space.

Source: The Game Website.

190217.name: The Con
videogamehonor: 2005 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
190217.description:
The story follows the life of a con artist who fights for money.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Con (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190218.name: Strike Fighters Legends
190218.description:
Publisher Website

Fly the legendary jet fighters! Cold War air-combat game on the go!

Use your phone's tilt sensor to control classic warplanes and engage in dogfights through aviation history!

Source: The Publisher Website.

190219.name: Austin Powers Operation: Trivia
videogamehonor: 1999 Game Critics Best Social/Casual/Puzzle Game of the Year Nominee
190219.description:
User Summary

A trivia game based on Austin Powers.

190220.description:
As in the original game, in La Fallera Calavera 2 players need to find five ingredients to prepare a paella that calms the wrath of la Fallera Calavera. However, this expansion includes new ingredients that the zombie might not like. Both the shrimp of Dénia and the spy mussel provide benefits to players, but may be rejected by the Fallera if she is not in a good mood (please note that the seafood is not included in the traditional valencian recipe for paella). The chorizo, however, will always be rejected by the zombie. No players with the chorizo ​​on their counter can win the game!

This expansion includes 52 new cards and a coin that must be flipped in certain situations.
190220.name: La Fallera Calavera 2: els ingredients de la discòrdia

190221.name: Nigeru tamashii, Nemuru oni
190221.description:
User summary:
逃げる魂・眠る鬼 (Nigeru tamashii, Nemuru oni) is also referred to as にげたま (Nigetama) by the publisher. The game title literally means "Souls escape while ogre sleeping".

In this game, players are fallen souls in Hell, and try to escape from Hell while Oni (the guard of the Hell in this game) is sleeping. Each player has their own bag of advancement chips. There are three types of advancement chips: +1 space, -3 spaces when drawn twice, and -3 spaces when drawn once. You may continue drawing chips as you wish, but when you are forced to retreat three spaces, you may not advance any spaces.

As the game goes on, you will have more chips in your bag, changing draw probabilities. You should build your chip pool in your favor, but your bag may be swapped with another player's, so you need some strategy.

This game comes in scroll shape, and the game board is actually a picture with old Japanese style. It can be hung on the wall as an interior accessory.

Publisher's summary:
地獄に堕ちた魂たちが、地獄の門番である鬼が眠っている隙を見て、天国への脱出を目指します。プレイヤーはそれぞれ中の見えない袋を所持し、その中に入ったチップを引いて進めます。チップには一マス進めるチップ、二つ引いたら三マス戻されるチップ、引いた時点で三マス戻されるチップの三種類があります。三マス戻されるか自分の選択で引くのをやめるまでいくらでもチップを引くことができます。ゲームが進むごとに袋の中のチップが増え、確率が変動していきます。有利になるように自分の袋を育てますが、袋自体を交換されることもあるので、戦略も必要です。
また、このゲームの最大のウリは、巻物の形をしているということです。和のテイストを最大限生かしたビジュアルで、壁に飾ればインテリアにもなります。

190222.name: Red Scare
190222.description:
User summary:

Characters have seven Skills: Strength, Aim, Speed, Social, Education, Pilot, and Street Smarts. Skills have Points, running from 1-8 at character creation, distributed from a pool. Characters also have a Career and Hobby, both yield a bonus on checks in that area. Opposed actions are resolved by the character rolling a D6 dice pool (the number of dice determined by the relevant Skill) and possibly modify them by Career or Hobby areas. Results of 6 and above count as successes. The opponent (or game master) then roll D6 dice pool which may cancel one or more successful results. If any successes remain, the action is successful.

190223.description:
It's a holiday gameboard for Munchkin – a Christmas decoration for every level, plus spaces for the decks and discards, so Santa can make his list at a moment's notice. Includes male/female tokens in six colors and matching colored markers with special in-game bonuses for each player! And you get four brand-new holiday-themed Munchkin cards!

Special Holiday Gift! On the back is a 20-room layout for Epic Munchkin!
190223.name: Munchkin: Yule Log

190224.name: Arete: The Philosophy Board Game
190224.description:
The time periods covered in the game are Ancient, Classical, Hellenistic and Roman Greece.

The theme and focus of the game is on Ancient Philosophy and the various schools of philosophy that flourished in these periods, e.g., the Academics, the Stoics, the Epicurean Atomists, etc.

Players take control of a scholarch, or headmaster of a school, and will explore Athens and the world defined by these time periods. Players will move pawns through nodes and pathways on a board representing Ancient Athens. Landing on event spaces will allow players to draw and play from nine different decks of cards, with each card containing both historically and philosophically flavored text and mechanics to implement in-game. Additionally, some spaces will grant players access to various in-game functions, such as a market to buy and sell item cards, a gymnasium to restore health or a temple to supplicate and bid for the help of the gods.

The goal of the game internally is to be the player with the most virtue points. Virtue points are earned by triumphing over other players in the in-game battle system, Dialectics; successfully completing events; recruiting pupils; being in possession of specific items.

While dice rolling will determine successes and failures in the game's event trials, pupil recruitment and actions in battle, players may tilt the odds in their favor when they allocate more of their virtue points to whichever statistic or trait (depicted by the four Socratic Virtues in-game), wager or sacrifice unallocated virtue points for a temporary advantage or collect the abilities of various pupils and items in the game.

And taken from the back of the game's box:

Philosophy is a way of life and the sweetest of the Muses. She importunes you to seek excellence in virtue and cultivate your body and soul. Explore the Classical and Hellenistic periods of Ancient Greece along with its rich Traditions and charismatic Mythos, as you take part in Dialectical arguments in search of Truth, participate in the bustling civic life of Athens, and travel outside of your Mother City seeking opportunities to exercise your Wisdom and practice your Craft on. Aiding you in your Homeric quest for Socratic virtue are loyal pupils, capricious gods and your soul's affinity with the ordered cosmos. Virtue does not come from contemplation alone, but through the application of Reason to right Action.

190225.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 20.

5 Cloister hex tiles.

Each round, place one cloister (in place of a black-backed tile) onto the central black depot. All other rules regarding the black depot remain the same.

As with other black-backed tiles, a cloister can be bought from the central black depot for 2 Silverlings, and is then placed onto an empty storage space in the bottom left-hand corner of the player’s board.

This owned cloister can be placed onto an empty space in the player’s estate that is adjacent to at least one previously placed tile and that matches the number on the player’s die.
The cloister does not have a function after placement, but simply helps complete a region.

Note: The size of a region increases by 1 for each cloister within it. However, a region containing one or more cloisters can never be greater than 8!

Example: A 4-space region with 2 cloisters on it is considered a 6-space region, earning 21 victory points instead of only 10.
190225.name: The Castles of Burgundy: 6th Expansion - The Cloisters

190226.name: The Gifted
190226.description:
User summary:

Characters in The Gifted are super-powered humans that must determine whether they will be heroes or villains. Characters have two "Colors" that determine their available super Powers. Each Power has a Rank, that starts at 1-5 (at creation) and can increase even further during play. Action resolution utilizes a modified 1D6 roll compared to a Target Number.

190227.name: Excess All Areas
190227.description:
From the introduction:

A Storytelling Game of Hedonistic Excess and Dangerous Braggadocio.

User summary:

Players begin with points of Kudos. The goal of the game is to accumulates as many Kudos as possible and the game is played until one player runs out of Kudos, as which time the player with the most Kudos wins. Kudos are gained or lost through successful or failed attempts at grandstanding. The game is played in a narrative process of describing acts that appear to be cool or fantastical.

190228.name: The Bloody Blades of Ares
190228.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Bloody Blade of Ares is a much sought after weapon of legendary power. Tales tell of the many bearers of the swords over the eons, known as the Sons of Ares, being changed through use of the bloody blades. They are known as paragons of violence and prowess in battle. There are no known records of any Son of Ares being slain while he was in possession of one the swords.

The blades are also said to unlock the Pillar of Eris, goddess of discord, and release her from her confinement at the hands of the Dragon Ascendant and the other gods of light. The Pillars are the abodes of the gods. Refuge and sanctuary, the Pillars dominate the surrounding countryside and marks the center of the god's power. Far round the Crystal Sphere the lands of Ares are locked in an eternal war with the gods of light. Darkness, bloodshed and fire mark and define the lands of Ares. Thousands of years ago the Blades of Ares began cropping up in the numerous battles surrounding those lands.

This PDF gives you the history, stats and powers for the Bloody Blades of Ares.

You also get the monster template for the Makhai, foot-soldiers for the Sons of Ares, wielders of the Bloody Blades.

190229.name: The Demon's Fang & The Armor of Nyx
190229.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Demon's Fang of the Hunters of Twilight is a cherished heirloom of that most foul and despicible order. They have used the Fang to assassinate countless individuals who oppose their cause. What cause that is exactly? No one can definitively state since everyone outside of the Hunters who have learned that secret have died with the Fang in their back.

The most imfamous and feared of the Hunters of Twilight was the assassin know as Dejagore. It is said he has killed more men than cholera. In his day he killed kings, princes and other leaders of men. His most famous exploit was destroying the Army of the King of Uruz all by himself.

This PDF gives you the history, stats and powers for the Demon's Fang and the Armor of Nyx

190230.name: Cryptid Hunters
190230.description:
User summary:

The game suggests the best setting is the 1960s era USA, though any period or location can be used. Characters select a Class (Hunter, Liberator, Seeker, Agent) that will shape outlook, goals, and provides some bonuses. Characters also have Skills, assigned from a point matrix, and Attributes, also assigned from a point matrix. Combat in the game is not emphasized.

The game is distributed as a three-page PDF file, though the third page is blank.

190231.name: Zombie Pigs Take Afghanistan
190231.description:
User summary:

All characters in the game are pigs that have been turned into zombies. The zombie pigs want to kill humans. Each pig starts with a suite of Traits, one is called the Ability and it as an attack, either melee or ranged. This is the only attack the pig can make, and ranged attacks are apparently made with "a projectile weapon bolted on". The remaining Traits are called Abilities and they allow the pig to perform certain actions. Pigs gain experience points by killing humans and accumulated experience points can be spent to gain additional Traits. The rules apply primarily to combat.

190232.description:
Plan Orange is a complete stand alone game inside C3I Magazine Nr29 published by RBM Studio that uses the "Empire of the Sun" (GMT Games) CDG engine to simulate a hypothetical Pacific war between the United States and the Empire of Japan in the early 1930s. The game features a 'what if' conflict based on the United States Orange (Japan) plans on how to respond to anticipated Japanese aggression in the Western Pacific. This is still the era of the Battleship ala Jutland supported by the early introduction of aircraft carriers that would be the capital ship that would dominate the real war that occurred 9 years later (1941).

The game comes with a full sized map, 48 cards, mounted counters, and rules.

www.c3iopscenter.com/
190232.name: Plan Orange: Pacific War 1930 - 1935

190233.name: Brightmore: Academy of Magic
190233.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are all fourteen-year-old students at a magical academy. Characters have a name and three Descriptors (Traits), and they are especially skilled in a randomly-determined branch of magic (Divination, Enchanting, Evocation, Manifestation, or Transmutation). Action resolution uses a simple die roll mechanism. The goal of the players is to earn points for their school house.

190234.name: The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel III
videogameseries: The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel
190234.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




The sequel begins a month after the end of the first title. A civil war has broken out between the Aristocratic Alliance led by the four noble houses and the Imperial Army of Erebonia led by the reformists, with Rean having escaped with Valimar after the fall of the Empire's capital city of Heimdallr. He makes it to his hometown of Yumir where princess Alfin also escaped to, but she is kidnapped along with Rean's sister Elise.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190235.name: Shattered Earth
190235.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are defined by six Attributes: Strength, Senses, Intelligence, Navigation, Engineering, and Science. All Attributes start at 1 and the player can then distribute points among them at creation time. Characters alone can do little in the game. Instead, the focus is on the spaceship that is shared by the adventuring party. The ship has various configurations and systems that can be improved during play. The party is so central to the game, trumping individual characters, that the character sheet places up to four characters and their ship on a single page.

The game is distributed as a three-page PDF; the third page is the characters-and-ship record sheet.

190236.name: Dubrovnik
190236.description:
User summary:

Characters are all crew members of the Dubrovnik, a giant and aging spaceship. Characters are assigned to a special operations group that does whatever their superiors command--usually this involves traveling to a planetary surface to accomplish some task or gather some resource. Characters have three sets of Characteristics, each Characteristic having three Attributes. Characters purchase Attribute ranks from a point pool during character creation.

The game is distributed as a three-page PDF; the third page is a striking and atypical character record sheet.

190237.name: Traitor (2-Page Version)
190237.description:
User summary:

Traitor is a visually striking game set in a dystopian future. The rules are fairly complex and wide ranging for a short game and some aspects of play will require game master input. Characters have several defining components with various names, but essentially these are Traits with narrative tags. Characters also have Skills and several other parameters that vary during play. The Skill system incorporates Attributes, Skill Depth, and other modifiers that apply during play. The core mechanic is somewhat complex, using at least two serial percentile rolls to resolve any action. The system supports critical success and failure results.

190238.name: The Sanguine Dynasty
190238.description:
User summary:

In The Sanguine Dynasty the players, as child members of the Resistance, have a collective goal of removing the Emperor without destroying the Empire. Characters have four Attributes (Cunning, Finesse, Grace, and Vitality). Attributes have values assigned from a standard array of 2, 1, 1, 0. Characters also have Health and Stability, which both are set at 5. Opposed actions and combat utilize a modified 2D6, with a final result of 7 or lower indicating failure; 8-10 indicating a weak success; and 11+ indicating complete success.

190239.name: Rise and Fall of the Empire
190239.description:
User summary:

This item describes a standardized process for creating sandbox campaign settings featuring a strong central empire. It references both the 9Qs system and several "Random Idea Generators" that can be used. The process is a solitaire exercise that will result in a basic structure and history of the empire (it might not survive the entire generation process).

The item calls itself a "hack" of The 9Qs.

190240.name: False Faces
190240.description:
User summary:

False Faces combines elements of a parlor LARP with very light-weight tabletop game rules. It can be played in a single session. One player assumes the role of the Mark (game master) and the remaining players assume the roles of Scuzz. During the game the Mark plans to pass on their inheritance (whatever that is--prestige, knowledge, wealth, etc.) and the Scuzz attempt to defame each other and finagle (presumably undeserved) favor with the Mark. Although most of the game is written narrative, some actions are resolved with a simple die mechanic.

190241.name: Huxley
videogamehonor: 2006 Game Critics Best Online Multiplayer of the Year Nominee
190241.description:
A Xbox 360 port was planned, but it has been put on an indeterminate hold.

In the near future, Nuclearites bombarded the world. Destructive earthquakes, massive tsunami and dramatic climate changes wreak havoc around the globe, isolating continents and driving the human race into chaos. Those who survive the destruction dream of tranquillity, but an eruption among the human race and the appearance of horrible mutants drives the world into further disorder. Racism and oppression cause rebellious uprisings and war that divide the landscape between two powers: Sapiens and Alternative. At the heart of the war emerges a powerful energy source called the Lunarites. The Lunarites were created by Huxley, a scientist and possible saviour.

Source: Wikipedia, "Huxley (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190242.name: Thoughtcrime
190242.description:
User summary:

The player group jointly creates their dystopia and Tyrant, using a few small random tables. The Tyrant is then played by the game master. The remaining players create Rebels, or characters. Characters have Skills and the game involves consistently wagering between opponents; the winner of an opposed situation gains the spoils of the wager. Rebels can gain experience points and then spend them to gain increased performance. The Tyrant may be overthrown slowly as the Rebels erode his power base; the rules provide a structure to accomplish this.

190243.name: Two-Page Space (Version 2)
190243.description:
User summary:

Two-Page Space v2.0 is a refined and revised version of the game that streamlines some processes and adds a few clarifications. It is otherwise very similar to the Version 1 implementation.

The game is distributed as a three-page PDF; page three is a combined character and spaceship record sheet.

190244.name: Pulp Fantasy (2014)
190244.description:
User summary:

Characters in Pulp Fantasy are defined by a Class (Warrior, Rogue, Priest, or Wizard) that determines their dice pool(s) for Skills (Tough, Roguery, Miracle, and Magic). All characters have four dice, but they are assigned by the Class selection. Combat and conflict use a dice pool mechanic where the number of dice is determined by the Skill rating.

The game includes a few magic spells, a few miracle spells, a few rules on advanced fighting and roguery, and a brief bestiary.

190246.name: Iron Cross
190246.description: Iron Cross is a World War II miniatures game that uses a dynamic activation system allowing players to always be involved in gameplay and constantly faced with tactical decisions. Playable in any scale, forces represent formations from company to battalion size. The rules contain scenarios and orders of battle for German, Comminwealth, US and Soviet forces from 1944 to 1945 in the European theatre of operations.

190247.description:
In Bloc by Bloc: The Insurrection Game, players join a vibrant popular rebellion struggling to liberate a city that changes with every game. Each player controls a faction of revolutionaries who must cooperate with other factions while balancing their own objectives in order to push back riot cops, loot shopping centers, build barricades, and occupy state districts before the military arrives and time runs out.

Bloc by Bloc is played in a city made up of 25 district tiles connected by streets, highways, and metro stations. Each player controls one of four factions in the city: the Workers, the Neighbors, the Students, or the Prisoners. Each district tile has a two sides: a repressed side and a liberated side. At the start of the game, all districts are repressed and, over the course of the game, players work together to liberate districts one at a time.

The game lasts 8 rounds. Each round is 1 night and each night has 2 phases. During the Sunset phase, each player takes a turn: 3-5 actions and ending with police movement controlled by the Police Ops deck. Each player starts with 1 bloc in the city and can add more throughout the game. On a player's turn, they roll dice and take one action (such as looting, occupying, attacking, or barricading) for each die rolled with 1+ of their blocs. Players may use loot cards to enhance their actions. After all factions have taken their turns, the Sunrise phase begins, which is when police attack and factions have a chance to liberate districts.

The police and the State are the common enemies of all factions. Occupations must be built in all State districts by any combination of factions for the insurrection to be successful. However, each faction also has its own secret agenda with a set of specific tasks that faction must complete in order to win the game.
190247.name: Bloc by Bloc: The Insurrection Game

190248.name: HARP: High Adventure Role Playing Gioco di Ruolo Fantastico
190248.description: HARP: High Adventure Role Playing Gioco di Ruolo Fantastico is the second italian edition of HARP: High Adventure Role Playing, and includes a 188-page core rule book with some original material and a 122-page booklet with two new scenarios.

190249.name: Cyradon: Ambientazione per HARP
190249.description: Cyradon: Ambientazione per HARP is the second italian edition of Harp: Cyradon, and includes a 172-page Campaign setting book, a 70-page booklet with six new scenarios and a poster with the Cyradon map.

190250.name: Ty the Tasmanian Tiger 4
190250.description:
TY the Tasmanian Tiger, famous as the hero that saved Southern Rivers from many a catastrophe and his mates at Bush Rescue have regrouped. Their new H.Q. in town of Coolarangah on the shores of Lake Burramudgee reaches out to help those in need whenever they are in danger.
One of the biggest dangers is a nasty piece of work called Boss Cass. A Cassowary who’s bent on putting all those hairy mammals in place with his army of Cold Bloods. He’s so mean he even flooded the new ruins of historic Burramudgee town so he could charge those warm blooded mammals for air-conditioning in the summer! What a stinker!
Things have been quiet since Cass set up a resort island of Cassablanca and “retired” there. Except strange, mysterious things are starting to happen around Southern Rivers like the shadowy figure that is said to have been seen on the outskirts of town. There’s a mystery to be solved for sure.

But first Bush Rescue is out to help one of their friends move his Thunder Egg museum.
That shouldn’t be much of a problem…

Source: The Developer Website.

190251.name: The Strange - L'Anomalia
190251.description:
From the English Publisher's Website:

Beneath the orbits and atoms of our natural universe lies a network of dark energy. Those who have learned to access and navigate this chaotic sea have discovered an almost endless set of "recursions" in the shoals of our Earth: Worlds with their own laws of reality, reflected from human experience or imagination, given form in the swirling Chaosphere of the Strange. Worlds teeming with life, with discovery, with incredible treasures, and with sudden death.

Worlds sometimes jealous of our own.

The Strange - L'Anomalia is the italian version of The Strange, including the core rules manual, an introductory scenario, players charts, and big maps.

190255.name: Peloponnes: Sikyon
190255.description:
Peloponnes: Sikyon is a new civilization tile (number 14).

It gives you 9 money, 9 grain and 3 population as a start. It's special function is that it protects you against Tempest, but as an income you'll lose 1 wood and 1 stone and gain 1 grain.

190256.name: Oxenfree
videogamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best Storytelling Nominee
2016 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
2016 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Nominee
2016 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Winner
2016 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2017 British Academy Game Awards Best Debut Game of the Year Nominee
2017 British Academy Game Awards Best Story/Narrative of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Story of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Nominee
2017 SXSW Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
190256.description:
User summary

Oxenfree is a single player adventure game, where the player plays the character Alex, a girl who has come to an island for a party together with her friend Ren and her new stepbrother Jonas. At the island, they meet up with Clarissa, former girlfriend of Alex' now deceased brother Michael, and Clarissa's friend Nona, that Ren has a crush on.

During the party, strange things start to happen, and the suspense/horror adventure starts. The game mainly consists of the player choosing dialogue and following the story that brings the five teenagers walking around the island. With the choice of dialogue, the player can influence the final epilogue when the adventure is over.

190257.name: Shakedown Hawaii
190257.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




2 LEGIT 2 QUIT
Retro City Rampage's Antihero is out of shape and out of retirement

2 BIG 2 FAIL
He's micromanaging a global empire; from the boardroom to the streets.

CORPORATE COLLATERAL
The open world is open for business. Time to close the Competition

Source: The Developer Website.

190258.name: Arms & Armor 1
190258.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pixel Loot is a series of treasure card decks for use in any fantasy-themed table-top role-playing game. Each card represents a different item, with a name, picture, and descriptive text. There are a variety of unique items in each deck, intended for DMs to randomly draw when creating loot for their campaigns, or for players to conveniently keep track of what their character carries.

190260.name: The Path to Luma
190260.description:
SAM, our galaxy-traversing Sustainability Augmentation Model, needs your help on a mission to save the galaxy and the Chroma civilization! Explore and manipulate wondrous worlds to unlock the life-giving sources of clean energy hidden within each planet.

Powered by NRG, The Path to Luma is a free adventure puzzle game with no ads or in-app purchases. Play as SAM, an android sent by the Chroma civilization to save the abandoned planets of their galaxy, and fulfill a quest to harness the power of clean energy. Explore 20 stunning worlds and solve mind-bending puzzles in a uniquely immersive gaming experience.

Source: The Game Website.

190261.name: Escape from Work
190261.description:
User Summary

Escape from Work is a point and click puzzle adventure in which players must solve 15 rooms of code-breaking, logical-thinking, and other puzzle types.

190262.name: Bank Escape
190262.description:
User Summary

Bank Escape is a point and click puzzle adventure in which players must escape from a bank after stealing the Royal Diamond. Players will need to find hidden objects and solve puzzles in order to complete the game.

190263.name: Kito
190263.description:
A promotional card game from a Belgian utility to promote saving energy.

Players in turn draw a card an than play a card to save energy, stop other people from doing so, or to get rid of cards that hinder them.

boardgameimplementation: Richard Scarry's Busytown: Eye found it! Game
190264.description:
Work together as a team of historians; scientists; and adventurers solving the world's greatest mysteries! Venture forth and find hidden objects throughout time from the Prehistoric Era to the Present Day. Race to the end of the giant 6-foot game board before your Timecraft runs out of fuel! But be careful not to go too far and end up in The Future!.

Encourages cooperation and teamwork
Builds observation skills and attention to detail
Reinforces object identification and matching skill
190264.name: Eye Found It: Journey Through Time

190265.name: Thrilling Expeditions Quarterly (Volume 1, No. 1 - 2009)
rpgissuearticle: The Beast of Gevaudan - A History
The Chronicles of Star Command - Crash of the Red Eagle
The Curse of the Red Shirt
The Gargoyle and the Adventure of the Monk's Eye
190265.description:
(from the editors introduction)

In this first volume, our feature presentation is The Beat of Gevaudan. This three part scenario for Gloire is baed loosely on actual historical events from France in the 1700s. We've even included a short history of the actual incidents to help set the scene for your game. On top of that we have some ghoulish archetypes and Weird War action for .45 Adventure, a solo play adventure for Fantastic Worlds, and a desert scenario for Broadsword Adventures.

You'll also find short fictional pieces that will help flesh out the Rattrap settings of New Commerce City, the universe of Star Command and the World of Tauren.

190266.description:
OVERVIEW
Sans Alliés (French: “without allies”) is a solitaire card game where you command 20th century troops and technology, pushing through an enemy nation bent on developing a vile super-weapon. Sans Alliés takes the feel of a grand-strategy, area-movement war game and compresses it into a tight little solo package, playable in about an hour.

GAME PLAY
The enemy nation is represented by an assortment of "region" cards arranged as a layered pyramid, with the "enemy capital" card at the top of the pyramid. Meanwhile, the enemy's "progress" towards completion of an ultimate weapon is represented by a proximity track along the side of the pyramid, which possibly increases each turn. The object of the game is to capture or claim the enemy capital card before the enemy succeeds in completing his weapon.

No region card can be removed from the pyramid until either one or both of the cards laid atop it are removed first. Therefore, you will need to capture region cards at the lowest level of the pyramid first, working your way up the pyramid in stages. Each attempt to capture a region is called an "invasion." To conduct invasions, you gather various military unit cards from your draw deck (separate from the enemy nation deck). These units have strength values, while each level of the pyramid has a defensive value. You have to amass enough strength and the right types of units to attempt an invasion on a given region, and then a roll of the dice determines whether you lose (discard) this entire invasionary force, or save a few, or lose more than expected, and are possibly forced to retreat.

Along the way, you can capture select region cards called resource centers, and/or you can invade select zones to liberate prison camps. These achievements not only increase the number of cards you draw on a turn, but also grant you the ability to improve your units strength values, and they introduce tactical developments that give you more dynamic choices in battle, including an Ultimate Weapon of your own.
190266.name: Sans Alliés
boardgamepodcastepisode: Low Player Count - Ep 24 - Card Drafting

190267.name: Bill Webb's Book of Dirty Tricks
190267.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

This fun little tome is a GM utility for use during regular play when either too many good things happen to the players due to luck or just whenever the GM feels they need a little push to remind them that success is fleeting.

Dirty tricks are intended to create great players. That is and should be the only reason a GM springs such things on them. It also has the effect of creating a great game, where even mundane tasks cannot be taken for granted, and boredom is rare.

190268.name: Planes of Punishment (Issue 1 - Nov 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Oh, and who shall you suffer beside?
A place stained with fear's stink
190268.description:
Planes of Punishment
Issue 1
November 2015

A seductive revulsion, a sickening attraction, a leper-temptation.

190269.name: Ninja Squares
190269.description:
Ninja Squares' is a tile placing game where your pieces are controlled by everyone but yourself. Players attempt to place the pieces of the other players in a way that satisfies certain conditions for their own pieces.
Players seek to have their tiles surrounded by a specific number of other tiles, earning one to four points with corresponding tiles needing the same number of other tiles to border them. When this condition is met, the tile is removed and the player gets that number of points. There is also a special fist tile that only comes to the player after another tile being removed leaves the fist no longer touching any other tiles, which is worth five points.
Players start with five tiles for each opponent they have in the game, plus their equal share of 12 total Mystery tiles. Players then place one tile at a time, until all players have placed all of their tiles. Whenever a tile is touching the exact number of other tiles that it indicates, it immediately goes to the player of that color for points. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

190270.name: Psychic Pathways
190270.description:
From publisher blurb:

Secret Paths of Occult Power!

Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Occult Adventures introduced psychic magic to the game, with five classes of psychic spellcasters, expanding the number of sources of magic from two (arcane and divine) to three. Unfortunately, certain aspects of the game that were made before the introduction of psychic magic, which could not have been predicted at the time they were made, are incompatible with this new type of magic. One such aspect was prestige classes, where prerequisites often required arcane or divine spellcasting specifically, such as with the arcane archer and the mystic theurge. While many GM's could simply rewrite the prerequisites if they chose, it seemed like the perfect opportunity to make some brand new prestige classes that specifically captured the psychic and occult flavor.

This book contains four new prestige classes for psychic spellcasters. The component artist blends arcane and psychic magic, in the style of the mystic theurge, but gains the ability to substitute one type of components for another, and gains benefits when casting spells with certain components. The dark mind infiltrator mixes physical stealth with psychic sneakiness, and specializes in warping the perceptions of their targets. The focused blade blends psychic powers and physical prowess, making powerful psychic strikes and using his blade to distract opponents from dangerous psychic assaults. Finally, the psychic intercessor finds common ground between psychic and divine magic, tapping into the will of the multiverse to invoke powerful divine interventions.

190271.name: Bugs Bunny's Christmas Game
190271.description: Dell printed different versions of this game in the first two issues of Bugs Bunny's Christmas Funnies in 1951 and 1952. Each game follows the plot of that issue's Bugs Bunny story, along with obstacles that match plot complications in each story. Both games are for two players; in the 1951 version, players can choose to be either Bugs or Elmer Fudd. In the 1952 version, they can be Bugs or Santa Claus. In both versions, players pull chits to determine the number of spaces moved and the winner is the one who reaches the end first.

190272.name: Happiness in Slavery (5E)
190272.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition compatible adventure for six to eight PCs of levels 4-6

The PCs are just bedding down for the night when the village is attacked by raiders. What at first appear to be simple bandits turns out to be more frightening when they discover the ‘raiders’ are not mere brigands, but foul Orcs. Worse, they have taken captives. With the help of several locals, the PCs must chase down these Orcs in an attempt to return the villagers.

The PCs chase the Orcs all the way back to their village. Unfortunately the rescue mission turns into a call for aid, as the PCs discover the Orcs are in as much need as their captives. While under no obligation to do so, the PCs find themselves assisting new (and unlikely) allies.

Also included in “Happiness in Slavery”:

A new form of lake boat
4 new Traps
A new island and village to explore!
A new first in cartography! Award winning cartographer Todd Gamble combines his top notch model scenery crafting skills with hand drawn cartography resulting in one of the most beautiful maps he has ever produced.
Multiple ways to complete the primary quest and an optional ending

190273.name: Dregordia
190273.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who...and What are the Dregordians!

Even though they look like 7 and a half foot tall crocodiles, they have emotions anyone could understand. These are a people who enjoy learning from the other races. They've long interacted with the Fae and have been a stalwart barrier against the Kal-A-Nar Empire's expension to the south.

A race, strange and Alien. Some think these folk are behind the Dragon cult but that couldn't be farther from the truth. These people follow The Way and choose logic and control over transitory feelings. Its probably a good thing...given that a moment of anger could mean the dismemberment of those less hardy races.

Come and travel in the living jungle and along the river to Ssatay. The harmony within is shown in the architecture, art and culture of this people - yet they have lived through generations of war.

This book contains everything required to base a campaign or character within Dregordia. You'll learn the history, weapons, art, beliefs and rituals of this strange race. There's even a bit of politics and even a secret or two we've shared.

190274.name: Reap
190274.description:
your ship breaks up on the rocky shores, but luckily you've made it to the island

every action tires you, but the sleep you get brings with it a return of energy

there is plenty of fresh water, but if you don't eat you will quickly starve to death

some of the turnips on board washed up on shore, but they're in limited supply unless you plant and grow them

when the ship crashed, you watched your treasure map tear and scatter to the wind

Source: The Game Website.

190275.name: Eclectic Beasts
190275.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world's most famous fantasy role-playing game has a huge monster book, but many creatures we loved in prior editions were overlooked. The 5e Fiendopedia brings some of these back and updates them for the 5th edition rules.

This PDF includes 5 creatures: Blink Dog (pack leader), catoblepas, girallon, shocker lizard, and winter wolf (pack leader)

Each creature gets a full-color image, 5th edition statistics & abilities, and background/ecology information.

190276.name: Nirvana's Agathions
190276.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world's most famous fantasy role-playing game has a huge monster book, but many creatures we loved in prior editions were overlooked. The 5e Fiendopedia brings some of these back and updates them for the 5th edition rules.

Adding the plane/realm of Nirvana to your setting? Or need some neutral good outsiders? Or drop the outsider aspect and make them powerful beast-men? This PDF includes 6 Agathions: Avoral (bird), Cetaceal (orca), Draconal (dragon), Leonal (lion), Silvanshee (cat), and Vulpinal (wolf/fox).

Each creature gets a full-color image, 5th edition statistics & abilities, and background/ecology information.

190277.name: The Goblins of Blood Wood
190277.description:
From publisher blurb:

Side Trek Scenarios, mini-adventures or encounters that can be thrown in with published One Shot Adventures! Each Side Trek is designed to work with, or independently of, its parent One Shot. Side Treks are intended to enrich the setting of each One Shot Adventure with additional information about areas mentioned but not covered in detail.

The first Side Trek Scenario is titled The Goblins of Blood Wood, a mini-romp into a goblin lair within the Blood Wood Forest of the Days of Knights One Shot Adventure. The characters can clear out the lair, in hopes of making the forest safer for everyone who travels its trails, or simply seek out whatever treasures that may lie hidden within the dank, dark tunnels below Blood Wood. This Side Trek also introduces a new skill, Miracle Working, and several Miracles for a character with the skill to use. Also included are several new creatures that are native to Blood Wood, and many new magical items that will spice up your characters' equipment lists!

190278.name: Order of War
videogamehonor: 2009 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
190278.description:
In the summer of 1944, World War II entered its end-game when the Allies launched two major operations that would drive back German forces on both the Western and Eastern Fronts at once. Order of War contains two campaigns, one American and one German. Order of War allows players to lead American forces to victory in the west and also places players in command of the German forces charged with repelling the Red Army’s offensive in the east.

Source: Wikipedia, "Order of War", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190279.name: Twilight Fall Core Rulebook
190279.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fall has come and with it the Twilight of Humanity....

Plague Zombies, Alien Horrors, Insane Robots and Computer Programs. The population of the Earth never stood a chance. A world of grim survival and constant death, Twilight Fall is a post apocalyptic setting where players must struggle against all manner of threat in an attempt to eke out an existence in a hostile world where death is only the beginning of the nightmare.

Twilight Fall uses a variant of Mini Six, part of the OpenD6 family of games which allows for quick character creation and takes only minutes to learn

The Twilight Fall Core Book Also includes:

Six unique character classes including AI's, Aliens and Modified Humans.
Over 2 dozen unique, hostile creatures and robots, all who pose unique threats
4 premade locations including maps, places of note, adventure ideas, and NPCs
Additional information regarding different terrains, threats in the wild, threats to survival, and other details needed to create and craft adventures and locations of your own.

190280.name: Marinthia Core Rulebook
190280.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the World of Marinthia!

Be a Noble Hero, a Wandering Adventurer, a Swashbuckler on the High Seas, a Mysterious Magician, or a Genius Inventor. This and much much more awaits you within the world and pages of Marinthia!

Explore the world on a quest for truth, justice, and knowledge. Made with both young and old in mind, Marinthia is a fun adventure game for the whole family with an easy to learn and easy to play rules light system in a rich fantasy setting.

Within this Core Book players and Storytellers alike will find:

Ten Different Player Races
Five Different Classes
Dozens of Spells and Inventions for players to use
Detailed world with several adventure locations
Nine Different adventure Jumpstarts
Several dozen readymade Monsters &Villains
Three Ready to Run Adventures
Easy to use D20 system with optional additional rules to tweak your campaign.

190281.name: Putting a Krampus in the Holiday
190281.description:
From publisher blurb:

Putting a Krampus in the Holiday is a tongue in cheek adventure for a group of low level PCs. This scenario takes place during the Filbar holiday of “Giftus” a ten day celebration that culminates in a gift exchange. This year’s holiday is threatened when a jolly Gnome finds a few items that turn a happy holiday into a potential nightmare! A short little adventure that can be played after your own holiday celebration!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a party of low-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

190282.name: Alternative Death Effects
190282.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sidebar #14 - Alternative Death Effects explores an interesting concept. What are some interesting alternatives to character death?

Disabling effects are an important part of the game, giving players and baddies alike a multitude of options to bewitch, ensnare, petrify, and even outright kill a target. But all too often, these ‘save or suck’ crowd control effects leave players twiddling their thumbs or playing with their phones until the spell either wears off or another player jumps to their rescue.

With Sidebar: Alternative Death Effects, you’ll find a new way to keep players invested in the game even after they bite the dust!

190283.name: Store Manager: Cellular Edition
190283.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Store Manager Cellular Edition is the most comprehensive and accurate retail store simulator ever created.

This game incorporates all the actions a store manager has to do. Find employees by searching through resumes. Each resume is randomly generated with names, old jobs, education and more. Each one of these individually affects that employee’s “ability skill”. That skill is much needed in many situations. If a customer comes in knowing what phone they want and you have it in stock, a salesman with a higher ability will be able to sell them on the accessories they need, driving up the profits on that sale. If you don’t have a phone in inventory, a higher ability is going to be needed to persuade a customer into a phone you do have in stock, and ensure they are going to keep it without returning it later.

You have full control over the inventory! Every day you must order new phones to keep your inventory fresh for the customers! A new phone comes out that’s a dud? Well you better discount it to get it off the shelves! As it stands right now there are 16 different phones for customers to choose, all from 8 different manufacturers divided up into three different OSs. There are accessories made for each phone and the player can decide how hard they would like their game to be. The player can choose to control all accessories down to which ones product by product, or if they don’t like that amount of micromanagement they can choose to instead just buy a bulk of accessories that work for every phone.

The customers come into the store, most with an idea of the type of phone they want. Customers can have their mind changed on what to purchase, but if they don’t like it they will come back and return their purchase. Each customer has their own unique name and data to keep track of. Keep those customers happy and they will tell their friends about your location. Other customer traffic is based on advertising campaigns that you as manager must select. Peak customer hours change frequently so you better be on top of the schedule.

In the beginning you are running a small shop that can hold four employees. Two of them can be working at a time. There is one opening shift and one closing shift. Don’t neglect your workers by not scheduling them, and on the contrary don’t over work them. Doing these things might get them fed up just enough to quit! You must schedule your employees correctly from the time they come in, to the time they break, to the time they leave. But be careful! Schedule breaks during peak customer times and the employee might not get to break that day, resulting in a fine for you!

As you gain profits it is up to you to upgrade all the displays and looks around the store to drive up customer ratings, giving more free word of mouth advertising which drives up revenue! You can upgrade individual displays as well as things like the desks up front your employees stand behind, the flooring and more! This isn't all for aesthetics. Customers like clean and modern stores! The better it looks, the more money they might be willing to spend! Gain enough money and maybe you can even move into that new huge retail space they just built across town! Room for even more employees and customers!

Source: The Game Website.

190284.name: FirstFable Seer Character Book
190284.description:
From publisher blurb:

The FirstFable: Seer Character Book is a supplement created to allow you to play a psychic Seer in FirstFable by OneBookShelf, Inc.

190285.name: Nathan
190285.description:
User summary:

Nathan is a very simple roleplaying game, designed to introduce basic concepts of roleplaying to new players. The game is designed for three players--one game master and two characters. The scenario always involves the two characters attempting to escape from a dungeon where they are captives. The two characters are pre-generated and have only a few Traits such as perception and movement. The game features a light fantasy setting.

190286.name: Planes of Illusion (Issue 2 - Nov 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Where You Are, Where You Aren't, Where You Never Were

190287.name: Planes of Decay (Issue 3 - Dec 2015)
rpgissuearticle: A Place to Dissolve, to Be Everything
The Residents Squat Amidst Filth and Rot
What Disrupts our Harmony, our Glorious Cycle?

190288.name: Infinity Blade: Dungeons
videogamehonor: 2012 Game Critics Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
190288.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Infinity Blade: Dungeons was a planned prequel to Infinity Blade and was set several thousand years prior to the events of the first title. The Infinity Blade: Dungeons project was officially canceled in 2013, after developer Impossible Studios was shut down in February, just six months after it was originally formed.

190289.name: Minoqaur
190289.description:
An Adventure Puzzle Game for QR Codes. This is a single-player game that uses a set of rules built around movement within QR codes. You are an adventurer in a maze and must escape with the treasure while avoiding the minoqaur.

You enter the maze at the open spaces next to the corner-squares on the QR code. A sword, a key, and a cloak are drawn in each of those corner squares. A treasure is placed in the smaller square on the lower-right. The minoquar starts in the exact center.

Your goal is to get to the treasure and then escape (either via one of the entrances, or using the key) without encountering the minoquar. In each turn, you will move or tunnel, then the minoquar will move or tunnel towards you. Movement is tracked by drawing straight lines through the white corridors of the QR code maze. Walls are represented as black lines and must be avoided or tunneled through.

190290.name: Skullduggery
190290.description: A quirky, low-key, role-playing game where you must achieve a secret goal while plotting and describing your nefarious actions. Each action requires a "reality check" that decides whether or not you "get away with" whatever action you dream up and describe.

190291.name: The Invasion
190291.description:
User summary:

The Invasion presents a single scenario for gaming and is intended to be completed in a single game session. Character generation involves selecting a Class (Fighter, Ranger, or Mystical) which in turn pre-defines all of the remaining character abilities.

190292.description:
Out Last is a zombies vs. humans game that pits you against time and each other. Work with your team of fellow survivors to escape the zombie ridden city of Westbrooke before it gets destroyed by a Nuclear bomb.

As humans you must move from tile to tile locating objectives, fighting off zombies, and collecting items and weapons. Use the custom dice to fight off zombies. Once you and your teammates have collected the objectives make you must make your way to the exit before the nuke gets dropped.

The opposing zombie team places zombies of all sorts in the path of the humans to try and stop them from reaching the exit. If they are going down they are taking the humans with them.
190292.name: Out Last: Westbrooke

190293.name: Daemons
190293.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Avatars of Absolute Evil!

Mythic Monsters: Daemons brings you a dozen and one of the foulest fiends to ever darken the doorstep of the deepest dungeons. Servants of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse and harbingers of famine, death, disease, and war, daemons occupy an interesting middle ground between the calculating and insidious devils and the ravening and savage demons. They truly want what's worst for everyone, with a nihilistic amorality that embodies every awful instance and element of death, pain, suffering, grief, and loss in living form. There is no peace, no hope, no light, no faith, no favor, and no escape. Only an inexorable grinding down to nothingness will satisfy their entropic appetites. From CR 3 to 22, we bring you dangerous daemons of every description, from minor magical minions like the cacodaemon, venedaemon, and ceustodaemon that might answer the call of mortal summons thinking their mystical might makes them masters of the lowest servants of Abaddon, to the guardians and masters of the River Styx, the hungry hydrodaemons and the cadaverous thanadaemons. The latter deacons of death are joined in the hierarchy of Hades by the leukodaemon spreaders of pestilence, the meladaemons, scions of starvation, and the purrodaemon warbringers. Some daemons seem almost alien, like the insane insectoid derghodaemons and the tentacular planewalking astradaemons, but all live for the thrill of the kill, whether as brutish bruisers like the piscodaemon or the seemingly forlorn yet fearsome vulnudaemon. As if a dozen existing monsters were not enough, the mighty and megalomaniacal ignodaemons are formed from fallen souls of earthly despots who incarnated to evil now govern fiefs of their lesser kin in an elaborate feudal tyranny in the service of the daemonic deacons and harbingers, balancing subtle skills of sedition with the brutal fist of power. The cruelty of these evil overlords is revealed in short fiction from Todd Stewart, in an interview with the archdaemon of poisons and incurable affliction, with every ophidian utterance envenomed with evil.

The Mythic Monsters series from Legendary Games brings you dynamic and exciting mechanics alongside evocative and cinematic new abilities that really help creatures live up to their flavor text, whether they are creatures of real-world myth and legend or creatures born out of the RPG tradition itself. These creatures can work just as well in a non-mythic campaign as they do in one that incorporates the full mythic rules, as you can throw them at your jaded players who think they’ve seen it all or know the standard monster stats as well as you do. That look of surprise and “What was THAT?” will warm any GM’s heart.

This all-new 30-page supplement is a terrific complement to the Mythic Monster Manual, with over 220 mythic monsters and an awesome array of monster-focused abilities, feats, and more for your Pathfinder game!

190294.name: So Now You're a Time Traveller
rpg: So Now You're a Time Traveller
190294.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game do not have traditional Attributes or Skills. Instead, the character is defined by a series of (non-chronological) events involving time travel. Note the game instructions are particularly vague and it is unclear whether a game master is used or not; the game appears to be intended for group play but could arguable function as a solitaire exercise.

190295.name: Total Badass Forever
190295.description:
User summary:

Characters have six somewhat atypical Attributes (Dodge, Actions, Slippery, Combat Actions, Toughness, and Move Actions), augmented by a variety of unique "Badass Abilities". Characters are able to execute "Badass Maneuvers", including combat.

The game is distributed as a three-page PDF; the third page is a character record sheet.

190296.name: Vikings vs Cthulhu
190296.description:
User summary:

The characters are vikings who are given an assignment. Characters have three Attributes (Mind, Body, and Soul) with scores purchased from a point pool. Characters also have a special trait or ability, which may involve using runes to create magical effects. In addition, the game master will track a Sanity score for characters.

190297.name: The Agency: Heroic Talents System
190297.description:
User summary:

Character creation in The Agency: Heroic Talents System is unique - players create their characters by writing a short biography that is the character record sheet. Up to ten qualities, traits, or skills noted in the biography are designated as significant and these become Skills in the game. Skills provide a dice pool for action resolution and may be "exhausted" to guarantee success (exhaustion means the Skill can't be used again during that game session).

190298.name: Rover Rumble!
190298.description:
User summary:

Players in the game control survey robots that attempt to complete missions on a planetary surface. Robots are somewhat standardized but characters can gain options that alter some aspects. Most of the game involves territorial control though combat is possible. Game mechanics are simple.

The game is distributed as a three-page PDF; the third page includes several character record sheets and a hex play grid.

190299.name: Radiance Ablaze: Everlasting Perfection Under the Great Routine
rpg: Radiance Ablaze: Everlasting Perfection Under the Great Routine
190299.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game fall into established types; as their society denigrates individuality, no variation from the standard type is allowed during character creation. Characters then pursue their desired course of action using programmed operations. The game is unique in execution.

190300.name: The Heights
190300.description:
User summary:

Characters in The Heights all share nine "archetypes" (Sage, Face, Hero, Warrior, Rogue, Traveller, Tough, Fixer, and Sleuth) but each player ranks these archetypes, placing the most important ones last on the list of nine. The most significant archetypes provide the most bonus for opposed actions.

The game assumes a multi-dimensional and multi-genre campaign, and whenever characters move from one locale to another they are given the opportunity to reorder their list of archetypes.

190301.description:
Chemical Spill is a chemistry based drafting card game.

How to play:

Chemicals are spilled and each player gets 10 cards each. They are allowed to 'cleanup' one card before the rest are washed to the next player for the next round. Each round players select one card from the cards passed to them and continue to pass until all cards are chosen.

Players use the elements they have chosen to create molecules. Different molecules score different amounts of points (as seen on the scoring cards). Any elements that have not been made into molecules cost you points!

After each round users tally the molecules in their hand. After three rounds the person with most points wins!!!
190301.name: Chemical Spill

190302.name: Farm Mania
190302.description:
User Summary:
Farm Mania, much like Farm Frenzy and FarmVille, lets you manage a farm.

Positions of items (animals, crops, etc) are fixed and numbers are limited. The game is played in levels, each level requiring a specific amount of given items to be sold.

Originally this game was produced by Realore Studios and Big Fish Games and available only via their websites. Later is also was made playable on many free game sites, usually as a flash game, sometimes as Downloadable content.

Farm Mania is the first in a series of (so far) three.

190303.name: Farm Mania 2
190303.description:
User Summary:
Farm Mania 2, much like Farm Frenzy and FarmVille, lets you manage a farm.

Positions of items (animals, crops, etc) are fixed and numbers are limited. The game is played in levels, each level requiring a specific amount of given items to be sold.

Originally this game was produced by Realore Studios and Big Fish Games and available only via their websites. Later is also was made playable on many free game sites, usually as a flash game, sometimes as Downloadable content.

Farm Mania 2 is the second in a series of (so far) three.

190304.name: Farm Mania: Hot Vacation
190304.description:
User Summary:
Farm Mania: Hot Vacation, much like Farm Frenzy and FarmVille, lets you manage a farm.

Positions of items (animals, crops, etc) are fixed and numbers are limited. The game is played in levels, each level requiring a specific amount of given items to be sold.

Originally this game was produced by Realore Studios and Big Fish Games and available only via their websites. Later is also was made playable on many free game sites, usually as a flash game, sometimes as Downloadable content.

Farm Mania: Hot Vacation is the third in a series of (so far) three.

190306.name: Kineticists of Porphyra
190306.description:
From publisher blurb:

PRIMAL POWER AT YOUR FINGERTIPS...

When occult threats rear their hideous heads, the raw, elemental power of a kineticist will even the odds, manipulating the substance of the universe to his own design. On the Patchwork Planet of Porphyra, kineticists are going to need every blast, talent, and infusion at their finger tips to survive. Within the useful pages Kineticists of Porphyra you will find:

4 new archetypes, including the outlawed Elemental Avatars and Scions!
3 new elements, Light, Sound and Time, with attendant blasts and defenses
Over 35 infusions and over 50 utility wild talents!
New feats to use all of this material, and an amazing sample character...




A new and edgy character class that will revolutionize your game, walking the line being Gods and Magic- on the Patchwork Planet of Porphyra, from the gamesmiths at Purple Duck Games, where our games are what you want!

190307.name: Savage Thunderscape: The World of Aden
190307.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Epic World of Steam and Darkness

In Aden, a thousand-year Golden Age of prosperity gave rise to an unprecedented development: the fusion of magic and technology into a unique discipline called mechamagic. Arcane power, steam power, and gunpowder changed the world almost overnight. The Golden Age ended, and the Age of Thunder began. It seemed that there would be no limit to the industry and ingenuity of man.

Until the Darkfall.

A supernatural cataclysm of unknown origin, the Darkfall plunged the world into darkness as the sun was blotted out for only a moment. In that moment, every nightmare and horror imagined by the people of Aden sprang into existence, and the world was thrown into chaos. Villages were wiped from the face of the world, entire cities burned, and tens of thousands perished in an instant. It seemed that the world would die in flames.

But Aden will not die so easily.

Now, ten years later, the people of Aden struggle to survive in the face of unrelenting assault by horrors beyond imagining. It is a world of magic, a world of industry, a world of horror.

It is the World of Aden.

Savage Thunderscape: the World of ADen is a setting and mechanics sourcebook compatibly with the Savage Worlds role-playing game. Within the pages of this book you will find the following:

Details on the different races of Aden, seven of which are new to this work!
New Edges of all types, including new Arcane Backgrounds!
New spells, new technology, and new equipment!
A sample bestiary of creatures from Aden!
And much, much more!

190308.name: Advanced Arcana Volume VI
190308.description:
From publisher blurb:

Master the Building Blocks of Magic!

Two wizards face off against one another, both attempting to cast the same spell. Their hands go through the complex motions as quickly as they can, racing to finish first while struggling not to let a single finger fall out of place. An apprentice attempts to cast a difficult spell for the first time, and stumbles to a halt halfway through—what was the next word? Ixos, or isox?—if he guesses wrong, the spell may go horribly awry. A kindly old hedge witch tells a desperate client that there is a spell that does what he wants, but in order to cast it properly, she will need a lily that bloomed on a grave.

These are the kinds of exciting and dramatic moments that spell components have the potential to provide, but it’s not something you see very often at the game table, where spell components are often glossed over as though they were nothing. Pathfinder Roleplaing Game: Occult Adventures introduced two new types of spell components, and this book takes that idea to the next level by introducing spells with several new kinds of components, including:

Intricate components, which take existing components like verbal and somatic to a dramatic new level in exchange for powerful returns.
Energy components, which draw on the caster’s own life force to cast.
Sacrifice components, which require a live, intelligent sacrifice to perform.
Soul components, where a captured soul is needed to power the spell (whose effect often depends on the soul’s quality).
Terrain components, found in powerful spells that can only be cast while in certain types of terrain.
…and a whole lot more!

190309.name: Witches Brews & Potions
190309.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not including the stereotypical hat, cauldron broomstick and familiar, a witch can often be found to be a good source of potions and brews, with the two terms often being used interchangeably by both the witch and the drinker. These brews often have odd and nasty sounding ingredients.

This generator, or series of tables, is designed to help flesh out any needed details you require. Use all of them or just one, they are entirely optional.

Featuring tables for:

Brewing method - Does the brew need to be stirred all the time or during a full moon?
Effect of the potion/brew, from bravery to curing a rash
A d100 table with 100 possible ingredients, many with linked sub-tables to further expand the details and options; Instead of "Blood of Dog", you could have blood of cat, elephant or something else
Duration of the brew
Possible side effects from consuming this potion

190310.name: The Elemental Ninja Part Two (Class Archetypes)
190310.description:
From publisher blurb:

More than simple assassins and agents of espionage, the ninja captures an air of mysticism and mystery. The following archetypes presented in this issue focus on the more supernatural aspects of this oriental character steeped both in history and legend. Second of a two part series, this issue introduces the Void Ninja, Water Ninja, and the Wood Ninja. For the oriental understanding of the elements is not the same as the Greek and traditionally western held belief in four, but in the five: Earth, Fire, Metal, Water, and Wood. In addition, a sixth element - the Void - is also covered in this series. In addition, a few new ninja tricks are presented that may be incorporated in to any ninja's arsenal of gimmicks and tricks.

190311.name: "Z" is for "Zombies"
190311.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heroes vs. the Walking Dead!

Z is for Zombies details a horror staple of the comics: the walking (and often hungry!) dead, including:

Different types of zombies from animated corpse to viral zombie, revenant, and more
Typical zombie abilities in Icons game terms
Infectious, super-powered, and non-human zombies
How to use zombies in your games, including an "Earth-Z" crossover with a world overrun by them!

190312.name: Professor Pleistocene
190312.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prepare to face the Prehistoric Prowess of… Professor Pleistocene!

A Power Level 11 Rogue, Professor Pleistocene is a one-woman threat from a prehistoric era! Professor Pleistocene is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Professor Pleistocene's file is designated "Gold" to denote that her powers are the result of external manipulation of some kind. Through a strange accident, the professor has gained the ability to absorb and imitate the properties of fossilized creatures! Now she seeks to continually expand her repertoire of abilities, ‘learning’ new shapes to transform into and collecting raw materials for future transformations without regard to ownership or preservation. Her lack of concern for the scientific community may put her at odds with heroes who seek to preserve and protect the development of science. Her animal motif makes her a fun foe for heroes with hunting habits, or heroes who are animal-themed themselves. With each new form she learns, she becomes more dangerous, and soon will be a threat to everyone if the heroes don’t find a way to reign in her bestial impulses! Professor Pleistocene comes with stats and standees for four super-beasts she can transform into, all illustrated in full color.

190313.name: Icons: Great Power Conversion Notes
190313.description:
From Introduction:

Since the ICONS Superpowered Roleplaying game was published by Adamant Entertainment in 2010, I’ve had plenty of time to look it over, and to think about it, play it, run it, and talk to other gamers about their experiences with it. That led to various notes scribbled in notebooks and word processing files about different places where the game could be clarified, expanded, or improved, particularly with regard to some of the powers.

As the introduction to Great Power points out, powers are at the heart of most superhero games, and ICONS is no different in that regard. While I set out to maintain consistency between the sourcebook and the published ICONS rules as much as possible, some changes were necessary to fulfill the sourcebook’s goal of improving and expanding the powers rules. This document provides an overview of those changes and how they may affect existing ICONS characters and what, if anything, you may wish to do to adjust characters accordingly.

The notes look at the power descriptions and rules given in the ICONS Superpowered Roleplaying game book in the order in which they appear, describing any significant changes.

These conversion notes do not go into detail on all the whys and wherefores of the changes, nor do they address the added material in Great Power, which stands on its own and builds on the power descriptions and rules in ICONS. As with all of the rules in ICONS (all rules in all RPGs, technically), the material in Great Power is optional, and you are free to use it — or not — as you choose and as best suits your own games. I sincerely hope that you find both the sourcebook and these notes useful and that they help to make your games more fun and enjoyable.

190314.name: Crisis on Christmas (M&M3E)
190314.description:
From Introduction:

What the heroes hope to be a peaceful holiday season turns decidedly strange when Mr. Infamy threatens the beliefs and hopes of children across the world, by holding Santa Claus hostage! If something isn’t done, the world may be denied the hope and joy of the Christmas season!

Crisis on Christmas is a holiday-themed adventure for the Mutants & Masterminds Superhero RPG. It is intended for a group of four to six power level 10 heroes, although the Gamemaster can scale the adventure to make it suitable for higher or lower level heroes by increasing or decreasing the power levels of the challenges as appropriate.

The adventure is set in Freedom City, but it can be set in any city suited to your own series. All the necessary material to run it is included here and in the Mutants & Masterminds Hero’s Handbook.

190315.name: Command & Conquer (2013)
videogamehonor: 2013 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
190315.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED
